Reviews.Title: “Convenient little spot to stay.”
Reviews.Author: efpub
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea typically once a year for several years now. It's one of those narrow hotels with only 8 or so rooms to a floor, to fit into the Manhattahan neighborhood. The staff is usually attentive and nice. The rooms are usually maintained in good shape. It's an industrial style, so heavy metal desk and side tables are the norm, but they look good. The rooms are not that large at all, but that's to be expected for this type of hotel of hotel in Manhattan, and they're big enough to do the job. Room rates can range quite a bit, from around $170 to over $450, so the value for price paid can vary a lot as well. We tend to do point redemptions for this hotel, as it's only 10,000 Starwood points per night, plus you can get the 5th night free, so 5 nights for 40,000 points is a good target. The hotel restaurant, Las Chicas Locas, spills outdoors into a seating area. It looks like folks are having fun there in the evening due to the ambiance. We tend to only use the restaurant for an occasional breakfast, but I would think people are going there to have fun more than they are the food. We did have one experience where we got a ticket while parked in the loading zone at the front of the hotel, since we didn't leave one person in the car who could verify to the police office that we were indeed 'loading' at the hotel. We did submit documentation and get the ticket revoked, so that was OK in the end. The hotel has some little placards you can throw in your window, so if you're by yourself, go in and grab one right away and put it in ther window while you check in. The official parking garage for the hotel is a little ways, over at 8th Ave and 26th st, so you can either roll your luggage one long and one short block, or check in first and then go park. It's convenient to FIT, and subways access is handy at 23rd and 28th streets.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, but a few concerns”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMan
Reviews.Content: This is a standard, clean hotel in a great location if you want Chelsea - near the Village, numerous Chelsea art galleries, colleges, etc. Ours was a mixed experience. I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights with my daughter. Room services were very good – the room was spotless each day, and the one time we made a special request it was addressed quickly and there was a follow-up call from the front desk to make sure it had happened. The front desk was similarly and cheerfully responsive to a number of small requests – a dinner reservation, info about getting a cab, etc. The rooms are small, but not by NYC standards. Sadly, after 2 nights on an uncomfortable bed my daughter decided to sleep in her dorm room instead of the hotel. The blinds hang 2 inches away from the windows, so it was essentially impossible to make the room dark at night without putting a blanket up over the windows - which takes considerable effort! My last night – before getting up at 5am to catch a taxi to JFK – I was wakened by garbage collection right in front of the hotel. Although I was on the 19th floor, you'd have sworn the truck was right outside my window, from around 3am to 4am!

Reviews.Title: “Average Room in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ktattai
Reviews.Content: No major complaints. Clean room but very small. In good location. Overall good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HTJ4
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to NYC in March 2012 was even more wonderful because of this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was immaculate, very quiet, and quite comfortable. The hotel has older furniture and appointments, but the rooms were a good size and the beds were wonderful. The hotel is small (for NYC)so it feels intimate and homey The hotel restaurant was closed when we were there, but with the fabulous location (we LOVE Chelsea), finding great little restaurants for reasonably priced breakfast/lunch were no problem. What this hotel lacks in luxury, was more than made up for in location, friendliness and easy access. We will definitely stay here again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, though noisy and so so service”
Reviews.Author: 3ecrm
Reviews.Content: Spent couple of nights last week, liked the location, within walking distance to many financial institutions where our meetings were, close to shops and restaurants. Though the hotel itself is very dated needs serious renovation, also lower floors are very noisy due to the street traffic and a disco behind the building. Booked taxi to go to airport, though looks like the front desk didnt do that, and only called after our inquiry about when the taxi would come.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BrianN64
Reviews.Content: We spent a night there in March, 2012. We were pleased by the location as well as how clean the hotel was. The room was spacious by NY standards with two double beds. Most importantly, it was bed bug free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Kathyn21
Reviews.Content: We booked this room in advance and when I showed up in New York City at 1:00am all I could think is what did we get ourselves into. The area looked a little rough at night however looks are deceiving – This city is beautiful. We walked into the hotel and were greeted with a friendly smile. Check-in/out and parking were quick. We got up to our room - 2 teenagers in tow and were pleasantly surprised. The room was as small as we expected but it was clean and very comfortable. We were always engaged by friendly staff no matter where we saw them. The restaurant was under construction but there were many great places to eat in the area. The Hotel was walking distance to almost everything this beautiful city had to offer. We did have a couple of issues - one of the elevators was broken and it took 3 days to fix and there was a bar with a patio located outside our windows which was noisy at night until about 2:00am. I mentioned them to the staff and they were very understanding and tried to change our room however the Hotel was booked solid for the weekend we were there. If I went back to New York - I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, but desperately average overall”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here on business this year. The location is good enough, and is a few short blocks walk to Penn Station and the shopping districts — equally, a short few blocks walk over to the High Line Park down to Meatpacking. Overall the hotel feels a little dated, and only having one working lift (out of two) during my stay made leaving and entering the hotel a slower process than was really necessary. The rooms themselves are small, and the bathrooms smaller again — but I was pleasantly surprised to find that both the bed and the bathroom were faultlessly clean. Were I to stay again I'd probably try and avoid the street-facing rooms and ask for one of the higher floors to reduce some of the city noise, but even so, you're likely to be woken up by some of the rowdier guests arriving in their rooms in the small hours: there's little to no soundproofing on the doors leading to the main hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location but Extremely Average”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: Well-located if you prefer to stay below Midtown (I do) with easy subway access to the Village and Soho. Friendly front desk staff. Rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller and views are generally lacking. Think Holiday Inn Express. I stayed here to earn SPG Points and because I snagged a good discounted rate. Can't recommend it unless you find discounted rate or do not plan on spending any time in room other than to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great city spot @ suburban prices”
Reviews.Author: Alex P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my G.F. - Great view of downtown from 18 floors up - Quiet, clean & wonderful value - Booked a room at the same price I'd expect to pay in the suburbs - Starwood is a great hotel chain & they have my every confidence

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Reasonable, Low-Key”
Reviews.Author: lkefct
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a great stay in a decent location. I really liked that it was so accessible to the 1 line, so getting anywhere on the west side is a breeze! Wifi was great, employees were very professional even when dealing with the unreasonably demanding customers in front of us when we checked in. Very clean rooms, with all the basics covered. Beds were a little small, and not much space to "hang out" especially with four of us crammed into one room, but that's Manhattan for you! Overall I was very pleased with the stay and would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing "low tourist" location.”
Reviews.Author: Netlizard
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Small & friendly and felt like a boutique hotel but the price was right! Room was clean and well appointed. Yes, the free bottled water is a nice amenity that we appreciated it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the beds are too small. I wish I had a measuring tape with me. We had two double beds and they really felt like oversize twins-smaller than regular hotel beds, I'm sure. I will definitely stay here again. I love being away from Times Square and all the sky gazers. There are great restaurants and a Whole Foods market in this area. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee38
Reviews.Content: Great room perfect location. You can walk to Times Square. Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, reasonably priced Mid-town hotel”
Reviews.Author: plumeria54
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the hotel and found it clean, quiet, it was a decent size room, very helpful staff, and good location - it was a great deal for the price. We were able to easily reach all parts of Manhattan from the hotel, and it was within easy walking distance of Amtrak at Penn Station as well as for visiting NYU. Would stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Stayed 11 nights, felt like I was at home!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: I stayed over a week this past summer. It was a fantastic experience. Fresh tea or coffee in the lobby every morning along with complimentary NYT and Wall Street Journal. I ordered room service twice and it was brought swiftly within a half hour. You are located very close to FIT, a whole foods, and the subway. Chelsea is a a beautiful area of New York and everyday can be a different adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Orange_Turtle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location in Chelsea. The hotel only had two elevators but they were pretty quick and I never had to wait very long for them. The hotel has a small courtyard outside the lobby that does a nice job of separating the entry from the street. The Lobby was pretty small, but the staff was excellent and friendly. They were able to check me in quickly and were nice enough to give me a late check out time. For the price the room was excellent, especially so in NYC. You won't be having parties in these rooms but they are not cramped at all. Beds were nice and comfortable. Bottled water, coffee and tea were complimentary. The bathroom was nice though a bit standard with a little weak hot water pressure, but I still had a nice hot relaxing shower. The hotel does offer complimentary internet, but in my 8th floor room it was pretty slow. Tethering 3G internet from my phone was faster. I'll defiantly look there again next time I'm up in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel, no wi-fi?”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily11
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here recently with friends on a weekend trip. Check-in was easy, and since we arrived early, they held our bags in storage until our room was ready. The location is great for wandering around Manhattan. And the street is pretty quiet, which makes for sound sleeping. If you go on a weekend, there are two awesome flea markets just down the street on Sundays. The rooms vary in size -- two of us shared a smaller room that was more cramped, and the other two had a larger room with more space. Although the rooms were clean, the furniture is pretty banged up. There was also no luggage rack, which annoyed me, but I don't know where it would've gone anyway. The beds were comfortable with fluffy pillows, but the sheets rustled really loudly. I was worried I was going to wake my friend up every time I turned over. The bathroom was clean, partially new and partially old, but very clean. Great water pressure in the shower and the usual comically small towels you find at most budget-priced chains. About the wi-fi: we were given a password, but when we tried to connect, none of our smartphones could get on the network. If we were staying for longer, I probably would've mentioned it to someone. But for one night, we just didn't care enough. Some of the employees were perfectly nice, but a few were less than friendly, like they would rather be doing anything instead of working there. Not even a smile. Is your life really that bad that you can't even smile at your guests? One other thing to note: there are only two elevators, and they're tiny. Just something to keep in mind. Oh, and don't expect to get the right drink out of the vending machine. My friend went to get a Coke Zero and ended up with an orange Fanta instead. She did get her money back, though. All in all, for the special price we got, it was a pretty good hotel. Certainly not perfect, but I'd stay there again on a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: harveyxyz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. I was a little worried about the whole bug issue. The room was very clean. No bugs in sight. The bathroom also did not disappoint. The staff is extremely friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to make another quick trip if the prices would only come down a little. Only thing is if I was staying longer than 2 nights, a small refrigerator in the room would be very beneficial. For me the location was great. I could easily walk to the places I needed to go. Next time I think I will request a room in the back since the sirens can be a little loud.

Reviews.Title: “A local Gem”
Reviews.Author: MancunianTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate a friends birthday. We chose it due to the location in chelsea near the bars and restaurants and we are spg members. On check-in we were greeted with a smile and helped us with anything we needed including bar and restaurant reservations. we had the premium rooms which came with a view of the empire state building on the upper floors. slightly larger with a sofa and bigger bathroom. Very clean and well apointed with free wifi with good connection. The best positive for the hotel is the staff, extremely helpful, polite and knowledgable of the area. The downside is the cost, for the time we stayed it would have been cheaper to stay at much nicer 5* hotels in times square. we chose the hotel for location so paid the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, good value for NYC--but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: avidforafrica
Reviews.Content: This is a great little property in an outstanding location. For what you pay--it is excellent. I have stayed there twice, and find it quite adequate when i am on a budget. In one room, the window did not open and that makes ventilation/heating tricky. The bathrooms are tight, showers only, but again, good value. The bed is very comfortable which to me is an unexpected pleasure in a budget property. I did not have any trouble with the internet. The hotel is a little noisy--guests slamming doors, some noise from Manhattan. They are changing food/restaurants, but the coffee in the lobby in the morning is excellent. I would stay there again for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: tyesse983
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend and another couple. Here are the basics. Check-in: Quick and easy. Professional staff. I arrived early so I inquired about room availability, knowing that check-in was not until 3PM. As expected, my room was not ready. However, they did offer a similar room that was ready for check-in. We decided to wait for the room with a view, but the effort was appreciated. Room: Clean, Comfortable, Average sized for NYC. The room was very up to date with all of the modern conveniences needed for a short stay. Nice view at night. The hotel was very quiet as well. Dining: The on site restaurant is currently closed. Not much for dining right around the hotel, but a quick walk or cab ride will offer plenty of options. Continental breakfast available as well. Location: Safe, quiet street. If you are not familiar with New York City, this is not the most lively part of town, but you have easy access to everything. The Village is just to the south, and Times Square/theater district to the north. Overall this hotel served its purpose for a clean, comfortable night while in town to see a show. Very comparable to the Hilton Garden Inn a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: angeljav748
Reviews.Content: My 4 day stay at Four Points by Sheraton back in November was a great experience. Very very friendly staff, clean room and for New York was kinda roomy. Everything was clean, large windows so you are not suffocating and best of all the rate I received during Black Friday was amazing! It is very close to time square either by a short walk or cab ride. I say walk and save your cash. There is a Whole Foods in the area, Subway and an awesome Dominican restaurant with the best cafe con leche and man made breakfast...fit for a carnivore like me! The restuarant adjacent to the hotel had an awesome happy hour. One should enjoy their stay!!

Reviews.Title: “No Heat ......”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Katy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Four Points in Chelsea because it was convenient to where my brother was hosting his 50th birthday party. We weren't expecting spectacular -- it was modestly priced and we would have been happy with a modest room. Which is exactly what we got. No bath mat. Plastic cups. But not "horrible" just "eh." There the story would end if it weren't for the major failure -- no heat in the room. The hotel was booked solid. It was late. Etc. etc. etc. They did give us a space heater -- but it was one of the coldest nights of the year in New York. The thermostat said it was 55 degrees in the room. On the whole, this looked like a moderate, OK place -- but the lack of heat made this one of the worst experiences we've had lately.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: vitt71
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel on business travel and was not impressed. The rooms are small and just passable: the shower tap fell off while I was trying to adjust it and the heating was noisy and difficult to control. They were revamping the kitchens so I was told only continental breakfast was available to us; pity that the groups staying in the hotel were allowed the full breakfast. When, surrounded by people eating scrambled eggs, I asked some myself (and offered to pay for them) I was told it was not possible … what happened to customer service? NY has near infinite hotel options: would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little run down”
Reviews.Author: dotbot
Reviews.Content: For $139 in Chelsea in a weekend it's hard to complain but Starwood needs to put a little love back into this spot. Worn furniture, surfaces, hallways, lobby to name a few. Staff has always been just friendly enough but still NYC short. Location is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: PVH65
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised Sheraton would have a hotel that has rooms that look this shabby. The dark furniture in my room had many scuff marks. The towels were what you might expect at a Motel 6. No bath mat was provided during my 3 night stay. The wallpaper had some stains, and the room had a window unit air conditioner. The immediate neighborhood wasn't great either. On the plus side, I was afraid that the hotel would have bugs (bed bugs or roaches) because the room looked so run down. Fortunately, I didn't see any. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated compassion”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: Very kindly refunded a ``non-refundable¨ reservation after I cancelled due to serious illness in family forcing cancellation of our travel plans. Will definitely look forward to booking with a hotel that has such compassionate staff. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not much more”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Four Points Chelsea is perfectly located in Chelsea, a hip part of town with lots of restaurants and clubs. The hotel is within walking distance of MSG, Greenwich Village and Times Square, so the central location can't be beat. As for the actual quality of the hotel? It was fine. The lobby is very small and can get very crowded with only a dozen people. The front dest staff was friendly and cheerful. The room itself was very small with twin beds and a HDTV with basic cable. It was certainly clean and the bathroom was stocked with decent supplies. Normally, I don't use a hotel room for more than sleeping, but a snowstorm arrived and I had to be in the hotel more than I expected. Because the hotel is kind of basic, I was going a bit stir crazy. So if you are looking for a clean, affordable place to stay in a great location, this is a pretty good choice. If you want more in a hotel, I would stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “It is New York!”
Reviews.Author: Red996
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small and shows the wear and tear of an older hotel. Lobby is shared with a restaurant that is not really part of the Sheraton. Stayed on points, so we didn't have to actually pay the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Anik17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated. It is close to all the cool neighborhoods: Soho, Meatpacking and Tribeca. We could walk everywhere wich is the way NYC should be seen. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (the bed is as comfortable as a W Hotel bed). Service was very good and all the employees were polite and helpful. You get more for your money as this hotel is inexpensive for NYC standards. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: calcalino
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the subway, grocery stores, pharmacy and other shops. I am an art gallery afficionado so the hotel is exceptionally convenient for Chelsea and the Flatiron building. However the hotel itself was not quite up to the standard that its online presence would suggest - the furniture had seen better days, there was only one bed side table for two people and the bathroom was cramped. On the other hand, there were some lovely extras - free wif fi and free bottles of water every day. The room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nychellzkitchen
Reviews.Content: Great Location but an average hotel... this is good place if you want a clean inexpensive hotel in a great location. I stay here often when I am just in for a quick trip and need to be in a central location. The people who work here are very nice and the room is clean but small... but if you are in NYC do you really need a big room? I suggest this hotel to anyone who is on a budget but wants a safe, clean and good location hotel. It is right around the corner from Whole Foods... which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Almost Boutique Hotel in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerTodd
Reviews.Content: First off the Four Points Chelsea is in a great location at 25th and 7th Ave, 1-2 blocks away from numerous subway lines in just north of Chelsea and south of Penn Station, Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are more than adequate size-wise for a NY hotel, the furniture modern and comfortable, the wi-fi and coffee are free and there's a nice restaurant and bar in the lobby. We got an awesome deal on the room by prepaying the full stay in advance, saved around 25% on the spg.com website. This hotel is quite the bargain and while its operated by a big chain it feels like a small boutique hotel that really focuses on customer experience at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JohnLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. It is very centrally located and it is a good value for the price. The staff at the front desk can be a little bit brusque but I have usually had good interactions with them. They are definitely more attentive to Starwood Preferred Guests. I was stuck there for 3 days during a hurricane in August and I was happily surprised that the hotel didn't try to gouge me for the extra 3 days. The rooms are small but well designed and clean. For the money I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4-5 star hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on 25th street bordering the area of Chelsea and the old NYC flower district. Chelsea is our "artsy" area with tons of small restaurants, boutiques and it borders the meat packing district in the south. Location of this hotel is excellent. My room was regular size for NYC. The finishings looked somewhat new and my room was very quiet. I received a cupcake upon arrival (delicious) and an offer of that days newspapers....very nice touches. They asked about my wake up call and I told them when it was. Wake up call came on time and I have nothing but positives about this hotel. Being that there are some EXCELLENT deals on this hotel, I would not hesitate to stay here again. Is it a W or a Riz Carlton? No, but for the price I have yet to find better then this last stay. Enjoy! NYC

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much.. so it was great to check into a convenient, tidy, clean hotel with nice staff and great service. Loved the room. It was quiet and reasonably priced. I'll stay there again next time I'm in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: eccentriq
Reviews.Content: Located in Chelsea this hotel is close to the Blue (A,C,E) and Red (1,2,3) subway lines which can basically take you anywhere in New York city if you are keen on transferring trains. The hotel is approx 50m to 2 Bros Pizza (25th St & 6th ave) if you are hungry during the night for a slice of $1 NY pizza. When we checked in on our first night (our first time in New York City) we were warmly welcomed by the receptionist, and greeted every time we returned. In our opinions as students, we thought the rooms were fairly modern with its furnishing & decor - considering how much we paid per night for 2x double beds city view. Complimentary bottled water and ethernet internet made the booking even more worthwhile. There isn't much I can say without reiterating what previous guests have said below.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Delight”
Reviews.Author: SyracuseGirl1981
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we stayed at this hotel. Be careful when using some GPS's (especially AT&T's turn by turn directions). It will try to take you to the same address in Brooklyn if you just type in the address with New York, NY. You have to use Manhattan. We were wondering why the GPS had us going a funky way until we realize it was trying to send us to Coney Island (hello)!! The hotel was perfect. It has a bar underneath. We were on the 4th floor and never heard the bar/nightclub below as some complain about. The bar is actually small so whoever called it a nightclub must live in a shoe. It is a nice bar though with decent bartenders. I believe it is a tequilla bar. We never heard crazy loud music pumping at all and noone was dancing. It was a holiday weekend, so I think guests had other places they'd rather be, however. The rooms are not bad in terms of size, compared to other places. They are very clean, smell nice and have an updated decor. There is a small closet and a shelf above the desk to store other items. The bathroom has no place to put makeup bags. It was easier to blowdry hair out in the bedroom area with the full length mirror. It is walking distance to the garden/penn station. One woman at the front desk helped us with transportation options, as we had to go to a wedding on New Yr's Eve on Park Ave. I forgot her name...she was Asian-- very nice girl. We ended up taking limo service because cabs were scarce and it would have been the same price with the amount of traffic that night any way. The parking was $55 for valet and they end up just billing the credit card on file. We had a large truck so I think it was 45 or 50 for a smaller car. Last time we came here, we parked in the garage across the street-- I believe it was a little cheaper. Beds were very comfortable. Shampoo/condit/soap/lotion is supplied in the bathroom. They also give you a bottle of water and coffee free in each room. We brought our own cooler and didn't have any issues. You will be happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: BridesMom2AJ
Reviews.Content: The best part of the Sheraton Hotel is the convienient location - on 7th and 53rd. Within walking distance to Times Square, the Theater District and great shopping. We were checked in early for our 2 night stay. The front desk employees were very nice and very helpful as were all other employees that we met. We were there during the very busy week before Christmas and the hotel was very crowded, but the hotel and staff handled the holiday crowd with a great attitude. The rooms and bathrooms are very small (not unusual for New York City), but comfortable and very clean. The evening lounge is transformed into Starbucks coffee shop by morning. Never had a problem getting a Taxi as the bell-men have them lined up and waiting. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bsannich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, leaving on Christmas Eve. The service was great. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. I needed some extra towels one night, and the were brought up within minutes, which was nice. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. The size was pretty good, too. I had a room with two double beds, and there was still room to put out my suitcase, etc. The bathroom was pretty small, but got the job done. It was clean, which (for me) is more important than size anyways. My only complaints about the bathroom were that every time I took a shower, the floor would get soaked (the shower curtain didn't do it's job very well), and the tub drained slowly. Call me crazy, but I don't like taking a shower and standing in a couple inches of soapy water. I never called them to take care of the drain though, as I think it's a common problem for a lot of hotels. The toilet also had a "magic flush" that took some getting used to. The view was awesome. I had a room on the 16th floor facing south (1602). I actually think this is not one of their "city view" rooms, but I had a great view of the under-construction One World Trade Center. Very cool to wake up to and go to bed to. The room had an operable window that I used quite a bit to get some fresh air into the room (ok, "fresh" is debatable, but some outdoor air). The HVAC didn't seem to work very well, but I can't really comment on it because I bypassed it for the window most of the time. There was a lot of noise at night though - sounded like a rooftop bar was around somewhere (people yelling and screaming and just having a good time). It didn't bother me, but for some people, it may not have been the best situation. The hotel is in a decent location - it's definitely not out of the loop by any means, but it's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city to be quiet and comfortable. A couple subway stops are pretty close - I mostly used the 1 on 23rd and 7th or the F on 23rd and 6th. Both were literally a five minute walk and could get you almost anywhere you would want to go. Speaking of 23rd - it's one of the busier crosstown streets and is only two blocks south of the hotel. My only major complaint was the terrible WiFi. It was easy to connect, but the speed was so incredibly slow, I was better off using my cell phone for most things I needed. All in all, I would say this was a great stay. I got a great deal on the rate, and I really enjoyed the room.

Reviews.Title: “This Four Points is the best I've been to.”
Reviews.Author: reachteresa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. Upon check in, I was helped by I think her name was Altia, she was very nice and gave me a cupcake and let me get into my room waaaaayyyy early. As she was helping me check in, another front desk guy gave me another cupcake!!! 2 cupcakes for 1 me!! Well, I had to give them both back because I'm an fasting but I'm very happy to even be given them at all. My room was clean, spacious, and quiet. What made this location better than others? Altia. I really hope that was her name. She was so nice, warm, and friendly. Thank you Four Points!!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Time In The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: HappyMom_10
Reviews.Content: Was here for just an overnight stay. A nice hotel and very reasonable for NYC. The room was spotless, as well as the bathroom. There were two double beds that were so comfy. Nice size flatscreen t.v., too. The hotel also has a restaurant (Las Chicas Locas) and bar. Other amenities as well. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise at a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Yaron G
Reviews.Content: You'd expect a hotel at such a lovely location to either charge the hell out of your pocket, or provide you tiny rooms with bad service. Surprisingly, there is not compromise on either of those. Rooms are comfy, very effective for the business traveler that also wants a walking distance from good shopping, bars, restaurant and lively Chelsea. Free internet, good TV, morning papers and a cosy bed is what you'd look for in much more expensive hotels. People have this prejudice about the lousy service level in New York. This hotel breaks this prejudice. Staff is very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: luvlacandi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while finding an apartment in NYC (we recently relocated here from Dallas). This hotel was PERFECT! The staff was friendly, the restaurant on site was amazing (and we're picky eaters), and the location was great too. It was awesome to fall asleep to the lights of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings every night! They also give you complimentary bottled waters and a cupcake upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, great staff, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: JimR1998
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of November. I was traveling for business and she tagged along to spend some time in the city. The location was excellent for us, lots of cool but not ultra trendy shops within a few blocks and plenty of restaurants to pick from. She enjoyed meandering around the day I was in training and felt safe doing so herself. We also walked here from the path train with our suitcases and that was easy-- only about 2-3 blocks. My wife's main criticism was the non-existent space in the bathroom, not even for laying a toothbrush! A different sink or small shelf could easily be installed to mitigate this. Putting your things on top of the toilet bowl isn't the solution. I didn't particularly care for the restaurant. Breakfast was on the low end of mediocre. You're in NYC-- plenty of places to eat besides here unless you're really pressed for time. The bed was clean and very comfortable. We had a minor issue and a the front desk sent a maintenance guy right away to fix it. Staff was very personable and made some suggestions for places to go. The room was on the small side, but plenty of room for a laptop and work area. We didn't spend much time inside so it wasn't an issue. It's not the Ritz-Carlton. But for what we paid and what other hotels were going for in NYC, we got a great deal on a clean room in convenient location with a friendly staff and wouldn't hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as many reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: mlomagno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in August during the NYIGF @ Javitz. Had problems the moment we checked in. Made a reservation many months prior for a 'city view' and paid extra for that privilege. However, hotel management has a different definition on the meaning of a view. They gave us a room that faced a inner area, towards a brick wall. When we brought this to their attention, instead of apologizing, they were visably annoyed that we were persistant in requesting them change our room. Finally, they gave us a room that was slightly above the roof of nearby building but I would hardly call this a 'VIEW'. We were not nasty to them so I think it is extremely poor customer service for hotel management to have attitude towards guests who expect what they paid for. We were willing to stay in an inferior room but they should somehow adjust the price accordingly. In the end, the room we got was spacious enough but starting to look a little worn out which is suprising since it is a relatively a new hotel. The bathroom was very small and hardly any room on the vanity for toiletries. So women beware if you come with a suitcase of makeup! LOL. Sink in bathroom leaked, towels were thin, worn out, had holes and/or slight tears. Will find and post the pics to prove this. Beds were horrible unless you love beds in which you sink in and need to climb out of the hole. To me, a bed should be firm but comfortable. Highlight staying here was entering the hotel lobby every time with the idiotic hotel manager, smiling like a clown and saying robotically "Welcome back!" even if you stepped out two minutes earlier to buy something. Very amusing since it was the manager that gave us attitude in the first place. After the whole check-in experience, we did not complain further. We tried to make the best of it since it was prepaid. However, we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: toritraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights, December 1 and 2, and it was excellent. The room was clean, had all amenities that the website stated and was a good size. The most impressive thing was the staff. Everyone that I interacted with was friendly, upbeat, professional and accommodating. (Front desk, concierge, restaurant and room service delivery guy) Sheraton should model this hotel in regards to the people they hire/train because this location is a perfect 10. People are who make the business at the end of the day anyhow. Most Sheraton’s are less than stellar, but this one’s a winner and I’ll be back. The location is excellent as well. Very nice area and close to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, mediocre rooms, nice reception but rude restaurant personnel”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and mediocre. The hotel is not too clean including in the rooms. Very worn out. The lobby area is tiny and not convenient. Food: food is average quality. Restaurant staff is not friendly (they said that they were not part of the hotel, which may explain their rudeness). Reception was friendly and helpful, apologizing for the rude service in the restaurant. Not sure why it’s called 4-points, when the hotel is actually 3 points at best. It is a shame for Starwood group to have both this and Westin hotels in the same portfolio. Unless you are on a small budget (although it’s also not too cheap), don’t stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel but a good solid winner”
Reviews.Author: phlashba
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about finding such a great rate in Chelsea but it turned out to be a very positive experience. Despite some issues with housekeeping that the GM took care of I found the hotel o be a calm oasis in Manhattan. While the furnishings are just basic (plain) what more do you really need? My request for a quiet room was granted without issue and I could have heard a pin drop ---- slept like a baby. Never any wait for the elevator and the staff was friendly and smiling throughout my stay. As long as I can get a good rate I will be returning. Oh and the location is actually quite good -- close to any amenity you might need and only a short walk to midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vacationerBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a quick getaway. For $150 on Hotwire it was perfectly acceptable. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. There was virtually no noise at night. Excellent night's sleep, As you can tell I'm raving about this aspect, I rarely get a good night's sleep in any hotel! We were on the 7th floor. The room as expected was very small, and a bit shabby (for example, tiles in the bathroom had been patched up, and the carpeting was dingy) but clean. Free water is a plus. Would not pay full price, but if you can get a good price here the 23rd St. subway is right around the corner, very well located for both uptown and downtown. Parking right next door for $30. It really was very tiny, and for longer than a one night's stay I would have definitely suffered from claustropobia, but it was ideal and nicely priced in the city for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: comingforthesun
Reviews.Content: We had a quick flight out of Seattle to JFK and took the LIRR to Penn station. An easy walk from Penn station got us to our hotel in about 10 minutes. Quick check in and yummy cupcakes from the front staff. Our hotel room on the 11th floor had two double beds and a walk in shower. Room was comfy and clean. Nice flat screen t.v. We had a view of the street. We really liked the location of the Sheraton. You are far enough away from Times Square and close to a Sub station. Lots of places to eat. We frequented the Whole Foods for snacks. You can pick up a coffee or a NY times at the front area when you feel like it. We asked for a small fridge and it was brought up the next morning (thank you) Not to keen on the work out area but whatever, Safe area, Clean comfy rooms and great staff. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fine Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Bali_High10
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary as some of the reviews dissed the place. I found it, although small rooms (typical to NYC) it was great. It had a nice King Bed with a good mattress, free internet with a ergonomic chair and desk, new flatscreen TV (at leat 38") It's right in Chelsea which is great between the Village and the Show district so it's about a $10.00 cab fare either way. Near the 23 street station for the subway and the area is safe with great Zaw on the corner, with Whole food (great grocery store) right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in late on a Friday night (about 1AM) after a three-hour flight delay. Our first hint that this was going to be a poor stay was that shortly after checking in, a barefoot girl stumbled into our elevator as we were about to go up to the room and was too inebriated to find her way back to her room, so she just started pushing random buttons. Another guest was nice enough to get her off the elevator and try to help her find her own room. Upon arriving on the 11th floor, the elevator doors opened to what appeared to be a party going on. I would estimate that there were 10 people partying in the room next to us, which led to a very loud evening (it was already 1AM and we were exhausted from traveling). To make matters worse, the knob on our in-wall heating unit (no central air/heat?! That's another story, I guess) was missing, which meant that we couldn't regulate the temperature in our room (kind of important for November). At first, I thought I was crazy and checked everywhere to see if there was a wall-mounted thermostat somewhere but there wasn't. I called down and the front desk girl was apologetic about the noise and room and said that they would take care of breakfast for us. The next morning, my wife and I were a little tired given that we got little sleep so we slept in a bit. I called down and confirmed that breakfast was served until 11:00 AM and so we arrived at the restaurant (a small place in the back of the building) at 10:20 AM, only to find out that the chef decided to "leave early" and that they therefore couldn't seat us. The rooms and hotel are very mediocre. I found the room to be lacking on the finishings and there were plenty of scuffs, chips, etc. that made it feel a bit more run down since the last time I stayed there. The size is okay--typical of NYC rooms. I'm extremely glad that I used Starwood points for the stay rather than paying the $400/night that they were asking. For that price, there are plenty of other nicer hotels in the city. Overall, I really liked the location and it was extremely convenient for what we needed to do for the weekend. However, the trip was so poor that I've already cancelled my next two stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Need Updating-Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Highridge6161
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located, easy to walk and subway close. We stayed in room 1903, which needs some fluff (chair, carpet both stained). Although it seemed to have good sound proofing windows, we heard traffic all night. Restaurant/Bar - really need work! Bartender need to be replaced. We would probably find a different hotel during our next visit to NYC. Maybe in the West Village.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the bar downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: JANENARELLE_11
Reviews.Content: If you are not familiar with the city but want close access to great food then this is the place for you. Have great happy hour tequila specials in the bar and whole foods around the corner. Need to pick up a baby shower gift so try Schneider's Juvenile not too far away. Lots of access to Zipcar too which makes touring the city fun and easy. Rooms are basic and a little tight but fir 1 person it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “just ok, there are better hotels for the price”
Reviews.Author: DJinSC001
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible hotel but not great either, just ok. Spent one night in the city piggy backing a work trip to the area but not in the city. Thought i would stay in Chelsea for the culture and charm plus it is not full of annoying tourists. No culture or charm, by the way. I spent $509 with tax for one night. I now wish i would have stayed at the W near ground zero for $75 less and dealt with the tourist. Room was clean, a little worn and in need of some renovation. Only two elevators and they always seem to be full of people, I used the stairs as much as I could and would end up on the street. The bed was great, clean comfortable, sleep like an angel. The front desk staff were great at check in and kind of curt at check out (the lobby was full of people). Lobby was always cold and very small, the bar had a $10 cover charge, they let me in to check it out but i didn't stay because the bartenders were to busy. I probably will not stay here again, to expensive for the location, price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: AnneR39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a quiet street by New York standards but a short subway ride away to Times Square, etc. Lots of places to buy breakfast nearby - huge Wholelfood supermarket on 7th avenue or Chelsea Deli which also sells hot pancakes. Plus for the heating and comfortable beds. Easily accessible free Internet access on the PCs in the lobby. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants nearby, e.g. China Fast Wok on 7th avenue - simple surroundings but cheap, fast and tasty food. Bombay Garden beside was a disapppointment with quite tasteless Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lawry12
Reviews.Content: Small, clean rooms in a great location near Times Square. Beds very comfortable. Views are not great but it is NYC. Staff friendly and helpful. We arrived in a snow storm after refusing to stay at the Beekman Hotel which was awful. They arranged rooms for us straight away with no fuss.Free tea and coffee in reception until 9:30. Telecon deli on the next block is great for breakfast. Recommend Tony's Di Napoli for pasta 43rd street between 6th & 7th Avenue. Food great and staff very friendly. If tour guide recommends John's Pizza on 42nd street don't go!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, nice location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lisfix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel right after returning from a Caribbean Cruise, so it would be easy for this hotel to fall thru, compared to that. But the hotel turned out all right, the room was small but clean, and the staff was very helpful. Also a big plus for having wireless internet connection in the room for free. The location was good, not far to walk to Times Square, and easy access to Penn Station. We walked to Penn Station with our suitcases, and that took us about 10 minutes of easy walking. The hotel also had a restaurant, but we didn't eat there. No breakfast included here, but there were plenty of places to get breakfast right down the street. We would definetely consider this hotel for our next visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Pleased: Good Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jneil
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at this hotel. We arrived a little before three and our room was ready. The front desk was very friendly and gave us our complimentary (and tasty) cupcake. As Starwood guests, we were on the 19th floor. We choose this hotel based on price and location. We've always had good experiences with Sheraton properties. Also, we were visiting friends and attending a social event and the location of this resort was key to doing both. Pros: Our room was a decent size (we are used to the small rooms you find in NYC and did not think this one was that bad in comparison). The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable. Upon arrival, we called for more pillows and towels and within five minutes, they arrived. Front desk was very friendly and gave us the late check out we had requested upon booking the hotel. The room includes a coffee maker and a bottle of water. Our view was great, overlooking the Empire State Building. The location was great and we had no problems getting cabs. The restaurant was hopping both nights we were there. Saturday night was a Halloween party and we had a hard time finding a seat for a drink. We did share a quesadilla earlier in the day and it was delicious. (My DH thought it was one of the best steak quesadillas he has ever had) We were disappointed it was only open for dinner. Cons: Not many but here they are. Only one bottle of water, one robe, and one cupcake at check-in while there were two of us staying there. Really, they couldn't supply two to accomadate the two guests staying there? The water pressure in the shower flucuated often (yet, the temperature stayed the same). Only one side of the bed had a night stand and it would have been nice to have one on both sides. Also, the window panels did not fully cover the windows and the light came in brightly in the morning hours. Overall, we were pleasantly pleased with our stay and would stay there again upon a return trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “4 Points Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: kathykellyconcordMa
Reviews.Content: Good location to Madison Park and Eataly. Rooms small but outside street noise was at a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: ScottWAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days before a New England cruise. The rooms are a little old but were fine. They were a little smaller than room outside of New York, but that is to be expected. It is in a quite area of New York. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Be sure to go around the corner to Chelsea Gourmet Deli. They are open 24 hours a day , and the food is excellent. It is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ritu G
Reviews.Content: This is the worst sheraton property i have ever seen. The price is outrageous and customer service is really bad. Worst place i have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice welcome”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand L
Reviews.Content: staff is very nice and friendly. Ideally situated in the city center, near all metro lines. My room was a bit noisy because on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Small, well located, friendly, quiet”
Reviews.Author: jmptrips
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Chelsea has a great location, small floor plates, so less hallway traffic, a friendly staff, comfortable rooms and great rates...also allows cashing in of Starwood points at 10k/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location because of Whole Foods and Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: LKnSF
Reviews.Content: Clean, good staff, but typical room size for NYC. Getting here is easy if you take the Long Island Rail Road from JFK and then walk the few blocks - best way to get in and out economically.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: bruno68
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Nothing fancy, but clean and very well located in vibrant Chelsea neighborhood. Cool Salsa dancing club downstairs too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at 4 Point Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at this gem hotel back in July and totally enjoyed the experience. To begin with, New York hotels are expensive all year around even for a single room especially during the summer months. So when I found out this hotel offers a special rate of $140 a night for a nice double room in the middle of Manhattan with free internet included, I had to jump on the deal even it is 3 months ahead! Location of the hotel is simply unbeatable - in the heart of Chelsea between 6th & 7th. Hotel premise is on the quiet W. 25th street, totally tucked away from the busy traffic. So many shops and restaurants around and easy walking distance to subway stations with multiple metro lines (E line at 8th/23rd St. takes you directly to JFK). Definitely a good base for NYC trips. It is a not a new hotel but 4 Points did a good job of maintaining the interior/decor updated. My room was definitely roomy (considering this is NYC and you will pay a premium for space) and nicely decorated with two twin-beds, work station, LCD tv and an OK bathroom. Couldn't be happier with the space. . Hotel does come with a nice bar and a restaurant with outdoor seating which I did not use as NYC is filled with great eateries in every neighborhood so it's best to explore the dining options outside. Internet as mentioned, is included in the rate but there are two free computer downstairs in the lobby for guest use if you don't have a laptop. Many reviews here complained about the front desk staff and service but I did not encounter such problem during my entire stay. In fact, I considered them pretty ok, I guess it all depends on who you ran into. Maid service, on the other hand, could have been a bit better but it did not bother me too much. In all, this is an above average hotel from the amenities point of view. However for the room space you get - if you find a good rate, I must say this hotel provides some very good value. I have stayed in a number of other NYC hotels with smaller rooms, older facilities, mediocre service and significantly higher price before, all I can say is this 4 Point Sheraton certainly beats all of them. I would definitely return in the future, if I can find a special rate again.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: paolo l
Reviews.Content: bathroom very poor, front desk average service, but too much depending on the attitude of the single person, management absent nice view over the roofs and landscape of NY , from our room on 19th floor, breakfast inexisting

Reviews.Title: “Try harder”
Reviews.Author: Jenn S
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception desk was not friendly, and did not smile, welcome me, or give me any real eye contact. The rooms were plain and very common. I expected bettter, unfortunetly, I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea: Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Meg88Beijing
Reviews.Content: One block from Whole Foods Market is a big attraction. Free wireless is also good. Noisy lobby and adjoining bar was NOT an attractive feature. Au contraire! Front desk night staff a bit rough and more akin to a bar staff rather than to hotel staff. Rooms are spartan, no shower cap, no refrigerator, no extra's. A bit over-priced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine, in a slightly weird location”
Reviews.Author: CincyFamily04
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel when the typical Starwood properties I stay in weren't available or were overpriced because the UN was in session. I had stayed here before, so I knew what to expect. Smallish rooms, but still plenty of room to move around and a nice, well-lit work area. And, free wireless -- highly unusual in Starwood properties, and very much appreciated. A nice little gem is the fitness room in the basement. All new equipment, and I was the only person using it. It's a little creepy down there, but I was glad it was available. When I'm in NY, I tend to work very late into the evening, and walking back to this hotel at that hour, especially on 25th, is a little desolate. While I won't make this my first choice hotel, primarily because of it's location and my preference to walk back to my hotel later in the evening, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Oh, and you get a really yummy cupcake when you check in!

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: BennyOnTour
Reviews.Content: The street it's on is not very attractive, but this is not the Upper East Side. But it's safe, and well-located near numerous subway and bus lines. I have stayed here several times, and the best rooms are the higher floors on the street side. (There is a bar with a big outdoor terrace adjacent to the back side of the hotel and it gets very noisy on nice evenings - earplugs required.) The rooms are small (especially those with 2 beds), but well-appointed. As for the restaurant, the bar snacks are good, and I've never eaten dinner there. I would skip any breakfast package -- the service is slow and the food mediocre. For dining options, head south on 7th Avenue -- once you cross 23rd Street, start reading menus in windows, or search Chelsea, Gramercy and Flatiron in OpenTable. I like Singe Vert, Trois Canards and Eolo.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good place to stay in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: ghfatw
Reviews.Content: Located on a relatively quiet side street, this relatively small hotel has reasonably nice rooms (medium-size by NY standards) and is clean. The elevators are slow because there are only 2 and 22 stories (each floor does not have many rooms). There is an outdoor cafe/restaurant which is nicely situated as it is in a recess from the street. The front desk service can be slow as the area is small.

Reviews.Title: “Fit Our Needs Perfectly”
Reviews.Author: reecer
Reviews.Content: We are avid travelers and have stayed in hotels ranging from stilted tree lodges in Africa to five star hotels in Europe. We would not hesitate to book Sheraton Four Points Chelsea again and recommend it to other travelers. For our annual trip to the US Open tennis tournament in New York we booked a room for four nights (09/01/11 to 09/05/11) at the Sheraton Four Points Chelsea. We were not disappointed, quite the opposite, as we were pleasantly surprised. SFPC is a very nice boutique hotel at the corner of 25th Street and Seventh Avenue and a convenient walk to Penn Station and/or a subway station. Check-in by Lauren was very pleasant, personable and efficient. Upon check we were given a fresh baked cupcake from Billy’s Bakery. We were upgraded to a very nice room on the 15th floor because of our Starwood Preferred status. I had requested a refrigerator for the room and Lauren made sure it was delivered and called shortly after my arrival to ensure that the room met our satisfaction. The room was a very clean, nice size room and well appointed with all the necessities such as a hairdryer, iron/full sized ironing board and flat screen TV. The beds were three quarter size but very comfortable with nice lines and duvets. The room was cleaned exceptionally well and fresh towels and facecloths were provided each day. Bottled water and Starbucks Coffee were supplied and replenished each day. Additionally, bottled water was available and complimentary at the front desk. The location was great for our needs. We walked about 7 short blocks each morning to Penn Station to catch the Long Island Railroad to the National Tennis Center. Along the way we stopped for bagels at the Bagel Maven Café and Hot and Crusty inside Penn Station, both tasty and inexpensive. We also took the 1 Train to and from Times Square; very easy, very quick. Although we did not, you can transfer to the 7 train at the Times Square Station and travel to the National Tennis Center via subway. Check out was pleasant and efficient. My bill had one charge which we did not incur but the charge was quickly and pleasantly removed upon my request. We will stay at SFPC again and will not hesitate to recommend it to our friends. It fit our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: YM2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed in the perfect location. Almost anything I wanted to do was within short walking distance: Shopping, Restaurants, Music, really great. Another plus was that I got a good rate (somehow all the hotels where extremely expensive in mid-Sept 2011) The hotel is in a “regular” building. Each floor has two rooms in each corner, for a total of eight. The rooms are rather small (should I say cosy.) Somehow, my stay had many “small” things, each by itself can happen, but together, it is simply overwhelming. When I arrived, the computer was down and they could not look up reservations. They offered me a room on the second floor, I decided to wait (rather certain that I did the right decision). The wireless internet in the room is problematic, so I had to use the wired Internet (there is one in the room). Still, not sure why you need a password for a wired Internet, which intruder can get in. I needed to print a few documents, but I was told that the printer is being replaced (for the entire weekend, how much time does it take to install a printer?!) They did offer me to email them and print at the front desk. Apparently, when people called me to my room, they never got the reception to answer the phone, so I had to use my cellular for all my incoming calls (I much prefer to use the line phone when possible). Sunday, heard the receptionist explain to another guest that the concierge does not work on Sundays (huh ?!) On the good side, the staff that is there are doing their best and more (and I can say only good things about them). I think that the place simply need more people to work in it. The reception seems always extremely busy, too busy.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lorri855
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable we didn't sleep as the room let in all the street noise despite being on the 11th floor. The air conditioning worked but was not adjustable as the controls were broken off and taped up. The long window blind was about six inches too short letting in all the light. The furniture was old and outdated and there were cigarette burns in the writing desk giving the room an overall dismal appearance. The room was also very small and cluttered. We did not use the hotel restaurant as the first night we tried it was so noisy we couldn't conduct a conversation as it appears to be in a tequila bar open to the general public and was very rowdy. The only positive thing about it is its great location and competitive price compared to other central hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel, we were on the fourth floor at the front to start with and it was a bit noisy as there is a mexican bar directly below (which has very good drinks and nachos!) we asked to be moved and they did this straight away and they put us on the 7th floor where we could not hear anything as it was at the back of the hotel. The maid cleaned our room everyday very well. The only thing would be that the wardrobes and furniture need updating but it was not a big deal. The beds were very comfortable and overall we were pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in nyc”
Reviews.Author: becky2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Points Sheraton Chelsea for 4 nights Labor day weekend~The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The hotel is located very close to subway stations which was great! My husband and I had a great time in NYC and plan to go back in Oct. 2012~and hope to stay at this hotel for a second time!

Reviews.Title: “Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: I took my Mum to New York for a mini vacation and wanted to stay somewhere reasonable and clean. I knew that the Sheraton wouldn't let me down! Very good value for the price. It's about a 25 minute walk to Times Square, or a 5-10 minute bus ride from 25th Street & 6th Avenue. The beds were very comfortable, hotel very clean and I took advantage of the SPG discount rates, pay full price, get the 2nd night for 40% off. The staff were very pleasant and the Concierge services were very helpful. Thanks again to the Sheraton, they can always be counted on!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service, run down condition of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mitch C
Reviews.Content: My room smelled of mold, the air conditioner did not maintain a constant temp, the water pressure was poor and the land line kept disconnecting my conference calls. Other rooms had similar problems because I was there with other guests. Time to invest in renovations to the property. Also, I was called away on business and had to leave NYC early, I was charged an additional day as a cancellation fee and this was non negotiable. I travel 75% of the time and not used to this type of run down condition for a large metro city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: alexsw1
Reviews.Content: Booked this on hotwire.com for a decent enough price. Was not expecting much but this hotel is very good. Free internet, late check out, decent beds, service good, free papers and coffee... surprisingly well kitted out rooms (proper hangers, good toiletries). The fitness room has cardio equipment and some free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rose_LuiHang
Reviews.Content: The bed and view were super. I felt very comfortable and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient location in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jiamintoh
Reviews.Content: The location was good to get around from. Hotel had what I needed. Only minus was a late check-in. I was made to wait up to an hour for my room. Not much else is wrong with the hotel. Basic, functional, gets things done.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but couldn't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: RJG407
Reviews.Content: This hotel could greatly benefit from a refurbishment. It's not in bad condition, but there are clear signs of wear in a variety of places and there are some maintenance issues. The door to the bathroom in our room dragged on the threshold and had to be forced closed, which made it quite noisy to open again. There is virtually no counter space for toiletries in the bathroom. Other concerns included two maddeningly slow elevators and thin walls that made a nearby baby sound as though it was in the same room with us. The A/C in our room died shortly after we checked in and we called the front desk and were informed that someone would be up to check it. We left and returned later in the evening and it was still not working. We called the front desk again and were advised that the maintenance person had told them that it wouldn't be working again any time soon and so they were waiting to see what we wanted to do (we thought this an odd response, as we certainly weren't going to stay in that room). Some sort of note or message about this would've been more proactive and helpful. We asked for a new room, and after two callbacks, we were eventually relocated to one with a working A/C. The TV channel selection is rather limited. The in-house restaurant has a very limited menu, most of which consists of tiny appetizer plates, although the menu does not explain this. The quality of the food was mediocre. The front desk staff was a mixed bag; some individuals were quite pleasant and outgoing, while others bordered on robotic. On the plus side, we paid about $145/night for a room in the heart of Chelsea and within a block of subway access. The beds are very comfortable. The small lobby area includes two PCs with internet access and a printer, and this equipment is free for use by guests. We would stay here again if offered a similar rate, but would not pay more for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay...GREAT location...”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here, it's a smaller hotel that is well staffed and maintained. There is a small area in the lobby that has a computer and printer for business travelers. As for food, the hotel has a small mexican restaurant called Las Chicas. I haven't tried it yet so I am unable to comment. There is also a small club that I haven't been to, but I can't imagine it would be a place to party since there are so many other more interesting places in NYC... Location is what I like about this place...Subway is about 2 blocks away that will take you uptown or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: maven5645
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Traditional room. the hotel is relatively new. rooms are small- but roomy for nyc hotel standards for 2 people. room was clean and relatively quiet considering you're in manhattan. reception staff was very nice and helpful. location is good--just a 5min walk to bleecker. subway was only 2 blocks away. it has its usual stuff in the room - coffeemaker, safe, hairdryer, internet access. bed was comfortable and clean. i would definitely stay there again. there is a small fitness room but no dining room or restaurant inside the hotel. lot of eateries nearby though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: QuakerCity
Reviews.Content: I arrived early to start my work day and asked to check my bag. The desk already had rooms available and promptly checked me in! Very impressed. Was given a room on a high floor that had everything I needed: nothing more, nothing less. Service was warm and friendly always and nights were quiet. All of this at a terrific rate. I will definitely be back - when it's not sold out!

Reviews.Title: “Fun In NYC”
Reviews.Author: frances n
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in your hotel. Staff was very friendly & helpful with most questions asked. Rooms were pleasant and beds very very comfortable. Hotel & rooms kept very clean considering the people coming thru. Your housekeeper on 6th floor was very helpful and sweet. Asked for additional towels even though she was busy, she was quick to assist and help. Enjoyed the fresh coffee in lobby even though coffee maker in room with bottled waters. Also great knowing internet available in lobby with printer for your convenience. Walking distance to many stores, even a KMART on 34th between 7th & 8th, restuarants, bus lines and subway system. Suggest taking tour bus (additional cost) making the uptown tour first which was offered at front desk during business hours with representative. You will see so many things old and young can do and so much more than I can ever tell you about. Must see to believe. We loved it and looking forward to next visit. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice Four Points with a decent location.”
Reviews.Author: Deavster
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, you can walk to 34th street or catch a quick subway ride to Times Square. I have stayed numerous times at this hotel and have not been disappointed. The front desk is very cordial and accommodating. I typically get a platinum upgrade to their high floors and they usually have unique gifts or random choice gifts they provide. There is a Mexican restaurant that's not bad and it has a bar, its worth a visit. The rooms are comfortable and have the typically amenities. This hotel is a nice Four Points with a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Such a deal!”
Reviews.Author: LoladeTiburon
Reviews.Content: In the midst of wholesale decorations and designer businesses, this hotel is my new NY oasis. At $160 a night, in August, I can't imagine a better deal in the city. Our room on the 11th floor was quiet and super-comfy. Great location in Chelsea, a Whole Foods to eat virtuously and scores of good places to eat less than virtuously. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Julius G
Reviews.Content: Service was well, staff very friendly, courteous and helpful. Although a bit difficult to understand a smile speaks a thousand words. Room was always clean and ready to kick back and relax after a long day of sight seeing. Be sure your room is not next to the ice machine, unless you don't mind the noise. Free coffee and the use of a computer with printer downstairs in the main lobby. The location was superb, not quite in the smack middle of all attractions but close enough. Don't hesitate to ask at the front desk for tours around the great Manhattan area, suggest you start in the uptown area followed by the downtouwn tour. Be ready to do some walking, sneakers are a plus and start out early, too many things to see. Enjoy have fun and take plenty of pictures.

Reviews.Title: “It was absolutely Fabulous !! A return trip is a must !!”
Reviews.Author: athath
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business and actually had been in NC the week before for a business meeting and had to come into NY due to my daughter was enrolled in a college workshop at FIT. We live on the beach in California and the weather in NC was extrememly humid all week, as was the weather in NY, but the hotel and staff were absolutely wonderful. very efficient, very accomodating and truly sincere in attempting to make the stay as comfortable as possible. Every time I got on the elevator and there was a staff member, they were extremely friendly and customer service oriented. I certainly appreciated it. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic front desk and hotel staff - requests done in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler2011_11
Reviews.Content: Value for the money - booked few months earlier for the Summer month of August in order to get a great deal! Convenient to everywhere. Whole Foods Market, Starbucks, Fedex are just across the street or a block away. Newspapers: NY Times, WSJ and USA TODAY readily available everyday.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mfgib197
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about what I expected for the price. I would stay again, but not really seek it out. Like most hotels, service is as good as the person who's helping you - which, in my case, meant stony faces, sullen looks, and no help at all with my request for an early check in (in 95 degree heat on a Sunday), but also meant a cordial welcome when I finally did check in, as well as very nice service from a sweet curlyhaired kid in the hotel restaurant at breakfast. Best feature of the property for me is the location on 25th Street (i.e. in heart of Chelsea, not far from 23rd Street subway mega-location). I suppose, if you wanted to, you could try to make the patio scene fun (there was a musician playing out there at odd hours), and I was intrigued by the drinks menu in the tiny little restaurant. But, to my mind, those options would mainly be fun in cooler weather and/or if you were just killing time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and very central”
Reviews.Author: hampter
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here and had a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly, rooms were clean/comfortable and the location is central for traveling uptown and downtown. Time Square is within walking distance. The coffee in the lobby in the morning and the free internet access was an added bonus! The beds are extremely comfortable however the rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LauraGlenview
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Our air conditioner control was fluky, but otherwise the room was comfortable and clean. Nice hotel restaurant and lounge - decent food and not outrageous hotel prices. They even had happy hour $5 Margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Heart of Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: JohnJuneau
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location. It is located on W.25th/nearest 7th Ave. The hotel Staff was courteous, attentive. My every need was met. The beds are super comfortable. I recently stayed there for 03days, and what a deal I got. Leave your laptop at home. There are two computer terminals right in the lobby for hotel guests to use if you need to check your flight or information regarding a museum exhibit. I will definitely stay here again. And will spread the word.

Reviews.Title: “THE SILVER LINING”
Reviews.Author: HOTELGUEST7770
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and found it to be perfectly located and pleasant. This past trip I somehow threw my back out very bad. It was very hard to walk and I was in much pain. I am SO glad I was calling the 4 Points my home away from home !!!! Everyone there was super helpful in getting me comfortable and helping in any way possible !!!! Traveling alone on business does make you feel more vulnerable when emergencies present themselves. But honestly having the staff as helpful as they are at the 4 Points Chelsea made a bad situation much easier. Thank you to all the staff that were their for a guest when he truly needed it !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: yvetteatx
Reviews.Content: Hotel: I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel. We arrived in New York and stayed for 4 days. We checked into our hotel and it was quick and painless compare to other places. Upon arrival the staff gave my girls free cupcakes which was a nice treat for them as they waited for me to check in. The rooms were on the smaller size but for New York that is a pretty normal size. They had complementary Starbucks coffee and water every day in our room. Since we have had problems with bedbugs in the past we checked the beds before we unpacked, no bedbugs were found THANK GOD!
