Also they have 2 computers in the lobby to print out plane tickets or anything else you need. Another thing I loved was that they didn't charge a resort fee. I think hotels are getting out of control with that. Location: That was great too! The hotel was located within walking distance to 4 different subway lines and Penn Station. It never took us more than a 5-10 minutes to walk and get to the subway. Food: We didn’t eat at the restaurant at the hotel so I can’t review that but there are several food places on that block with includes a breakfast place, hotdogs, pizza ($1.50 a slice and good), Starbucks and Whole Foods. We ate at the breakfast and pizza place everyday and never got tired it. For a family of 4 we eat for less than $20 for each meal (includes tip and sodas/water) which is nice and then had a more expensive dinner in the city. Overall: We loved it and will stay there again when we are in the city. Thanks to the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Sunday is Salsa Night”
Reviews.Author: Cloudripper
Reviews.Content: Arrived late due to plane problems coming across the country. Got to the lobby around 11:30 to extremely loud thumping Latin music. Not inherently objectionable, but when I asked for a room in the higher floors (I think there were 22), I got the 2nd floor - right above the bar where Salsa Night was in full swing. Told when I checked in the music would die around midnight, it was still there at 2AM. I was tired enough to sleep. Room was small but comfortable, price was right. Signed up on the website for an upgraded room with a "city view", out the window was the dirty glass ceiling of the bar, and all directions was concrete, brick and graffiti. Nevertheless, the price was right - I'd give it a go again before writing this place off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: herecomestheflood
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would probably stay again, but the drawback was that one evening we came back to the hotel to find a loud and raucous party spilling over from the bar into the lobby, something we had never experienced at a hotel. And the pounding music from that same bar one afternoon prevented me from conducting a cell phone call from the computers in the lobby. The music was so loud I would not have even walked in the bar! And I normally don't mind loud music.

Reviews.Title: “good for my needs”
Reviews.Author: driveslots
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights on a business trip, and found it convenient to subway for both uptown and downtown. Easy to snag a taxi from there, also. Lots of grocery stores in the neighborhood meant that it was easy to grab snacks and breakfast to eat in my room. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful, but 14th floor hallway smelled of cigarette smoke the whole time (room was fine--no smoky smell). Service at restaurant was VERY slow one night, OK the next night. The food was OK; I recommend having dinner elsewhere. Got a good rate for Manhattan, and the room size was perfectly adequate. The double beds seemed small, but it may just be because I'm used to queen size beds on hotel rooms. Would stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “it was nice”
Reviews.Author: Kaptane
Reviews.Content: My 5 day stay was good once I managed my expectations. I had booked a deluxe king room and was expecting a room with a view and a little more "deluxe" in the room. After requesting a highfloor in my reservation i was advised i was going to be put on the 2nd floor but got it changed to a higher floor I travel a lot so I have become accustom to my version of deluxe. I guess in NYC a deluxe room does not have a mini fridge or guarantee a great view. The bed was great and comfortable and the location was perfect for walking to place or taking the 1 train. Staff were pleasant.. Only legit complaint would be the constant slamming of the doors esp by the cleaning staff. Overall a good stay

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very friendly, super wireless and just cool value for money”
Reviews.Author: alexanderkh
Reviews.Content: perfectly located in chelsea - easy to reach the best spots in manhattan - meat packing district, soho, village, also great for jogging along the hudson river park. the bar and the restaurant in the hotel is not so awesome, though...but who cares if NY offers so many excellent places, right?! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: whbs
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you are looking for a good night’s sleep, a spacious room with modern fittings or a location that’s pleasant and not scary after dark. My wife and I booked for four nights but stayed only one. Maybe had we stayed for the four nights we would have grown accustomed to the never ending rattle from the ice machine directly outside our room and the crashing of ice at all hours of the morning as other guests made use of this facility. Maybe we would have found a way to move around the room without crashing into each other. Maybe we would have found the somewhat decrepit fittings “quaint” or “charming” and got used to having most of our clothes stored in our cases rather than in the oh-so-small free-standing wardrobe. Who knows, we might even have got into some deep and meaningful conversations with some of the unsavoury characters who lurked around on the sidewalk outside the hotel. However we left, not because of these inconveniences, which many might regard as part of the “New York Experience”, but due to the noise that reverberated up from the alleyway below where the hotel restaurant is located. A Latin American/boogie combo band kicked off at 10.30 pm and was still going strong until almost 4am. The windows were literally shaking and conversation in our room was difficult – sleep was impossible. Calls to reception commenting on the noise level drew sympathy but little action as it turns out that the restaurant, whilst on the same premises, is not under the hotel’s management. In the morning, hotel management and staff were very pleasant and did their utmost to make good our dreadful experience, crediting our accounting in full, and were very helpful in finding alternate accommodation for the rest of our stay in NY. Apparently we were not the only guests with this complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRiveradeRosa
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is our FANTASTIC find and truly a GEM! I find some reviews here which are truly whiners and bickerers and not genuine experiences. We spent a week from 2-9 July celebrating our anniversary and birthdays. Always made us feel welcome! Just wanted to let you know we're hoping to stay again in the future and we highly recommend it. Thanks so much again! Thanks especially to Elisa and your guest/room service staff (you know what delivering customer service is and that's what makes the difference.) Kudos to all!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights over 4th of July. We used our Starwoods points, but checked the pricing, and it was very reasonable for NYC. Overall, we would stay here again if we wanted to be in Chelsea. The hotel is adequate by NYC standards. The room and bathroom were tiny (as expected), but had everything we needed. We were on the 16th floor, so it was fairly quiet, except for people opening & closing their room doors. The beds were very comfortable. The decor was a little worn - the bedskirts were stained (looked like mud splatters) and the shower floor was also a little yellowed. Free internet & free bottled water (2 per night, but you can always ask for more at the front desk) is great! Maid service was good, no complaints. Front desk was very friendly and efficient, never more than 1 person in line. The best part of the hotel is the location. Very convenient to subways, with lots of amenities nearby. We ate 3 different times at Eataly, Mario Batalli's upscale Italian food court/ grocery store - everything was simple but amazing. Also, if you like French macarons and pastries, you must try Maison du Macaron on 23rd -- amazing flavor selection. Starbucks just down the street. For the 4th of July fireworks, we were able to walk to the pier to see them, which was very convenient. If you don't feel like wandering out, the hotel restaurant has a great happy hour ($5 drinks) and decent Mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great!”
Reviews.Author: Fab40s68
Reviews.Content: Room was fine size wise. Furniture (wood) was beaten up/tired, shower had some black mildew at the grout lines of a couple of tiles. Location was great. Bed comfort was great! Staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Smith Family Hits the BIG APPLE”
Reviews.Author: MalibuJimCA
Reviews.Content: Nice Quiet Hotel, small floor plan. $5 cab ride from Penn Station and walking distance to Empire State Building. Rooms are cozy, but clean and beds comfortable (wish they were Queens and not Doubles but there would be no room) Staff is friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a clean/safe/secure place to stay without breaking the bank, then the Four Points Sheraton Chelsea is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: BahamaSam
Reviews.Content: My reservation on SPG website did not go through. However, Lauren at the Front Desk was helpful in booking a new reservation. Overall agreta experience. Icannot say enough about the staff at the front desk and overall service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: gourmetrose
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our son, his wife and 3 month old. No problem getting a frig and microwave for the room. Anything we called about was taken care of immediately and the front desk always called to make sure it had been. Rooms are usually small in this price range but they accommodated the baby by giving them a larger room for the same price. The location is great. Around the corner is a whole foods. And a choice of starbucks or a specialty tea bar is within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Functional!! We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: kathrynlla
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Small but quaint and served the purpose. Lot of little extras. Great staff. Very helpful and accomodating.Would stay here again if needing to be in the Chelsea/Gramercy Park area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shopgirlblonde
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night, only to find the desk clerk having a melt down about the many difficult situations he was dealing with. Deep breath. We checked in and found a small room, two doubles, with good beds and pillows, a good view, but no balcony as we had seen in recent posts here. Horribly worn and chipped desk, but under a glass top so ok with that. Cramped quarters, but ok with that, really. HOWEVER, the bathroom was awful and terribly inefficient - cracked and worn tiles in the shower/bath and one tiny shelf - and the smallest towels you can imagine. NO glassware/plasticware at all in the room - used Starbucks cups for mouthwash and water. I have to say I expected better from Starwood. I would say this property was just adequate, at best.

Reviews.Title: “Basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on the 17th floor in an executive king room. Arrived late morning and was able to leave my bag was not able to check in --- ok because it was just past 10:30 which is understandable.. Lobby was small and bustling. Returned to check in around 7 pm that evening and had to wait around 15 minutes because there was only 1 person working the front desk at that time. Lobby was still active. Received my room key and retrieved my bag and headed up to the 17th floor. Room was diagonal from the elevator which turned out to be okay --- i did not hear 1 elevator all night. Walking into the room, I was slightly underwhelmed. The bathroom is immediately inside the door and is small with a small shelf and shower only. Bathroom was clean but some of the floor tiles were chipped and the towels could use some serious upgrading. The room itself is best described as efficient but there is not a lot of warmth. Everything was in good working order however the ottoman had a big rip right in the center, the dresser was nicked from too many run ins with luggage, and the thermostat is oddly placed over the desk. Actually, I could never tell whether the thermostat controlled the hvac unit or not. My room stayed the same temperature during my entire stay despite my adjusting the thermostat. I did like the big windows and could see the top of the Empire State building easily. I also liked that there was an extra chair for relaxing. Pros: location, comfortable bed, quiet on the 17th floor -- never heard anyone else on the floor even though the hotel was sold out, free internet (although it is wired-only in the rooms -- meh), and windows open slightly to let some air in. Cons: tired room, service seemed impersonal, could hear a lot of street noise even on the 17th floor, the reading lamps were too high over the bed, and just a generally cold vibe. Decision: this won't be my first choice for a repeat stay and I'm a big Starwood fan however if the price is right and I can't get into one of my preferred stays --- then this is a basic place to rest my head for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Saw better times.. service is poor”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravellerMunich
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for many times over the last few years and always recommended but not anymore... rooms are small but comfortable, heating is quiet noisy and unstable temparature; however service and reliability dropped significantly whereas prices increased substantially; some parts of the room equipment not working; phone constantly "on alert" for messages but no messages there and deletion impossible; constant ignorance of requests to fix the problems by rude staff (esp. night shift) ; steep "upgrade" for SPG free night purposes;

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: tontybear
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed in this hotel (coincidently on exactly the same dates one year apart) but I don’t recall doing a review last year. The hotel has a great location on 25th/7th. There are subway stops on 28th and 23rd Streets on the 1 line so convenient – I prefer the 23rd street stop as this is where there are a number of take a way food stores a Starbucks and a Whole Food Market it so handy for getting a drink / snack. There are stops a few minutes walk away for the C/E line at 23rd/8th and the F/M lines at 23rd/6th. There is a PATH stop at 23rd/6th too. But 34th Street for Penn Station and Macys is only a 10 minute walk away. I recommend buying a weekly fun pass ($29) I recommend the Malibu Dinner just to the left on 23rd/7th for a good honest breakfast. I arrived on a Thursday evening and left the following Wednesday. I received a warm welcome but the whole check-in process was too rushed and I had to continually ask for a piece of information to be repeated. I appreciate that check-in should be quick but going too fast makes it slower. I was told that two parcels I had been expecting had arrived so I collected them when I returned after a short trip out. I was required to sign for these parcels (don’t recall having done this last year) but the process was variable (see later). At 10.00 PM I received a phone call stating that they had found two more parcels. Whilst informative I did think that this was too late a time to phone a room for something that was not urgent. Luckily I was not asleep but I did have a friend with me. I collected them the next morning. On the Monday I asked if a further parcel had been received and this was handed over without my having to sign for. However what was irritating was that this parcel has actually arrived (and had been signed for on delivery) the previous Friday yet I had not been notified. The whole signing for a parcel process is a good policy but it needs to be applied all the time. My King room on the 21st floor to the rear was a tad small (was enough for me travelling on my own and I had a larger front room last year so noticed the difference) but clean and kept clean by the friendly house keeping staff. However the view downtown was truly amazing. I left a note the first morning asking for extra coffee and towels and these were left for me every day of my stay. I also asked for a bathrobe but when this had not appeared when I returned that afternoon I asked again at the front desk only to find later on that it had been left in the wardrobe rather than the bathroom. All through my stay the bathrobe was left (folded) on either the chair or the bed but never on the hook on the bathroom door! Now what follows might seam to be a rant but these are really minor irritations that once the hotel addresses should not re-occur and improve the guest experience. At check-in I was informed that the Wall Street Journal would be delivered every day (other than Sunday) and would I like the New York Times too (as a benefit of SPG Gold). These duly arrived on the Friday and Saturday but on the Monday to Wednesday the entire floor were delivered USA Today. The WSJ and NYT were available in the lobby so no major issue but if you promise a particular service then you need to deliver it. The batteries in the safe needed replacing and despite reporting this to the front desk they were never replaced during my stay. The coffee machine etc is on a tray that is left on the shelf above the desk. However the nearest plug is on the desk itself so why not leave the tray (it is quite small) on the desk? The cord on the machine is too short to reach to the plug on the desk lamp. The free internet access is a great perk and one that many other hotels charge for but it would be good if there could be a connection on the bed side table as well as the desk for those of us who like to surf in bed. The muzak in the exterior area – WHY? It is far too loud and I would have hated to have a low floor, front room having to listen to it. Ditto the muzak in the bar / restaurant – it put me off going in for an evening drink. Light leaks – there were blinds but no black-our curtains so there was always some light leaking into the room and I do find this irritating. I also had to put a towel against the bottom of the door for the same reason. The hall lights appeared to be the same intensity 24/7 when they could be turned down during the night. The hotel booklet is very out of date and is a mix of the usual hotel info as well as tourist information yet this is all mixed up. The booklet states there are ice machines on the even floors up to twelve but then on the odd floors yet there are NO ice machines on any of the odd floors. The trip down to the 12th is not excessive but surely the booklet should be accurate? Apart from the minor irritations I enjoyed my stay and have recommended it to a number of friends. For its location and price it really does offer excellent value for money and especially for a NYC Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “always happy there”
Reviews.Author: christoph66
Reviews.Content: you've all you need for a good price. complimentary internet in room, f.ex. If you have a room in the upper floors, you'll have sun all day (courtyard), view over downtown ... and VERY quiet !!! Nice staff. So: I was never disappointed. Going there since 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Four PtsSheraton Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Swedishdawl
Reviews.Content: The lobby is small, but there is free internet service! The rooms are also tight quarters, but very efficient. There were 3 of us in the room. Beds and bedding are quite comfortable. We booked on priceline, finally got bid of $145, w/taxes $175.Pleased w/rate. We had to wait 5 hrs on the streets freezing, and we are from So Cal, so we thought we would die. We arrived at 5 a.m. The staff over all was pleasant and efficient. For the price, great deal. Subs 2 blocks away, able to get everywhere, Times square, Canal St, Central Park. We had a wonderful time! Oh, and the local restaurant they recommended had slamming food and prices! Greek owner, check it out! Also, the local pub, we watched the UFC fight at, super good food and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem hidden in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: snissley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a girl's getaway weekend to take in the Christmas sights. Once you get passed the bar/restaurant in the lobby, the hotel was very quiet. If we had enough energy left after a day of walking, we would have certainly wandered into the restaurant...sounded like a great time. But we knew an awesome bed awaited our tired bodies and would get us revived for another day of sightseeing. Subway just a couple of blocks away and we got to every corner of the City we wanted to in 2 and 1/2 days. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - but TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: I picked the Four Points Chelsea because it is two blocks from the office I was visiting. Very reasonably priced, good location for workers in the Chelsea/Mid-Town area, and it is super close to Penn Station. My room had "two double beds" - but don't be fooled, these are overgrown twin beds. I stayed by myself, but would not have wanted to share that size bed with anyone. I was on the 12th floor - and it was nice and quiet, a plus for a Manhattan hotel. Hotel was very clean! Well lit! They even give you a cup cake upon check in - it was yummy! Rooms and beds just very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for its location and friendly staff (which is important)!”
Reviews.Author: Highzone
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I expected it to be a bigger hotel as it is Sheraton but.... yes indeed, it is Manhattan! We enjoyed our 4 nights stay there as when I walked one block, Times Square is really near! We can walk to midtown or to downtown as it is located on 25th St. Subway is only 2 blocks away. The location is wonderful! The front desk person is very friendly. I called from JFK upon arrival in the morning from CA and he told me I can check in early so that was really great. Whole Foods is a couple of blocks away and ofcourse a bunch of other restaurants. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we did not try it as we went all over Manhattan to eat at different famous restaurants. We had free internet, too. I will definitely stay there again and recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel below Mid-town”
Reviews.Author: Mazlow
Reviews.Content: It’s hard to find a clean, modern hotel in the Village/Chelsea area without spending too much. Four Points is the exception. VERY friendly reception clerk. Immaculate room. Big over-stuffed bed. NO beg bugs. Cool shower. The rooms are small but it’s NYC ! I think cozy is a better description. No long hallways to trudge down. Foyer is clean, modern and slick. I will stay there again, without hesitation, as long as they continue to stay off the Beg Bug registry.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet night's rest in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with DH on our way back from a looooong transatlantic flight. So pleasantly surprised! The joint was jumping with whatever club they have off the lobby when we checked in, but our room was super quiet and we had no sleep issues from street noise. I was never able to say that about any apartment I lived in here! Bed was super comfortable and the linens were nice. Bathroom was clean, but could definitely use a polish. At this price for this location, one doesn't want to inspect the caulking too closely though. Great water pressure, plenty of hot water, in-room coffee, and a nice TV. Will definitely stay here again! Have a wonderful time in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel: About a 10 minute walk to time square, and a 2 minute walk to the subway Free Internet use in the lobby and a printer (you can print off your boarding pass) Friendly and helpful staff Clean and no bed bugs!! This isn't the Ritz, don't get me wrong, but it's an affordable and clean hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: Wom50
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Four Points Sheridan Chelsea, The staff were all incredibly friendly and accomodating. Althought the rooms are on the small side they certainly met our needs. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was quiet. I would certainly recommend hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable hotel at a fair price. I hope to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, nice room, helpful staff; almost 5-star”
Reviews.Author: AskingForHelp
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at this hotel; we made the reservation through Hotwire for $159 + tax per night. Based on the TA reviews, we were somewhat nervous, but we had a fine stay. The location of the hotel is superb, with great subway access and lots of restaurants and shopping. Whole Foods is a two-minute walk, and Trader Joe’s is a ten-minute walk. We arrived at 1:30 and were able to check in at that time. Front desk staff throughout our stay was uniformly friendly and helpful. We had requested a high floor, but the only room available at that time was on the 12th (of 22) floors. We had also requested a view of the Empire State Building, but that was also unavailable. But we were happy to be able to check in early and found the room to be small, as others have noted, but the bathroom was fairly large. The room was spic-and-span clean and had everything we needed, including a very large flat-screen TV, a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea, plenty of drawer storage, and an armoire. It was tight for two people to move around the room – but, as others have noted, few NYC visitors are going to spend much of their “awake time” in their rooms. The bed was wonderful, and the HVAC controls worked perfectly, allowing us to adjust the temperature just as we wanted. Housekeeping staff did a great job. Two things keep this from being a five-star review: (1) there are only two elevators and no stairs available, so there can be very long waits to get to and from your room; and (2) there is definitely noise at the back of the hotel at night from the restaurant/bar that others have mentioned. Few revelers were outside while we were there, given the cold temperature, so the noise level was bearable on Friday and Saturday nights. But during the summer, I would not want a room at the back of this hotel unless I was a very sound sleeper and I had a room well above the street.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, cramped, bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: culturalmuse
Reviews.Content: Rooms are too small for two people. The wallpaper, carpet, desk surface looked worn and shabby. Found a bed bug in the bathroom! Overall a DINGY impression not comfortable. Won't ever use Sheraton Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyworld
Reviews.Content: Nice place, moderately priced. Clean rooms and good service. Limited facities in public areas of the hotel but plenty close by. Walking distance to central Manhattan or underground is close by.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel: friendly and helpful staff; great room, nice lounge and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: camfa70
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. Our experience at this hotel was wonderful from the moment we walked in the door. The front desk employees were extremely welcoming, professional and helpful. In fact, every time we passed by the front desk we were addressed by at least one of the staff. Our check-in date happened to be my friend's birthday, which was acknowledged by the staff by sending dessert to our room shortly after our arrival. Our room was an upgraded suite which had a very cool view of the Empire State Building, which was another unexpected surprise. We were very pleased with our room, as it was neat, clean and tastefully decorated. The photos online are accurate representations of what the rooms and the hotel actually look like. We had occasion to interact with numerous service staff during our stay and all were incredibly friendly. We even had the pleasure of meeting the general manager, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome throughout our stay. We chose to stay in Chelsea because of the artsy feel of the neighborhood. It was removed from the hectic environment of Times Square, but close to a multitude of restaurants and the subway station. Also, it turned out that it was more affordable than other areas of the city. We would happily return to this hotel the next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, location, comfort ... Four Points has all of these!”
Reviews.Author: mos912
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a weekend trip and our stay at Four Points was exactly as we expected. I bid on the hotel using Priceline and when you do that, you don't have complete say in the decision. Once my bid was accepted, I took a look at the website and they were very specific about the rooms being small. Traveling with two teens, I contacted the hotel and they assured me that two doubles would be in our room (as opposed to one bed). We expected small, so no surprise. The staff was so helpful and friendly (on the phone and at the desk). The room was clean, but we had everything we needed in that small space ... if you're a family who doesn't get along, this room probably won't work for you. I gave this hotel a 5 because is was exactly what I expected, and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money at the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: teesdalewanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a few days before we travelled using Trip Adviser and so didn't know what it was before we paid for it. We got an extremely good deal and were very satisfied with all aspects of our stay. It was billed as a three star hotel and that is probably about right. It certainly isn't luxurious and in common with many New York hotel rooms, ours was small. Having said that, the beds were very comfortable indeed and the shower was generously sized and good (which counts for a lot). There was a flat screen TV and all of the other facilities you would expect. The staff were pleasant, although as our stay was largely problem free we didn't really test the customer service. The location was very good, being far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown, but close enough to be within easy reach and with good restaurants fairly close by. We would recommend the hotel if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room, Great Trip to NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC so I wanted to be close to the landmarks and the action for a decent price. I got a great deal on Priceline’s “Name Your Own Price”for $125/night for 3 nights and I couldn’t be happier with the hotel they picked for me! I arrived early via the subway and had no problem finding the hotel even though it’s set back and the sign is a bit hidden. Even though I was a few hours early, the front desk promptly checked me in and offered me free NYC maps. I got to my room and realized it was 2 doubles when I had requested a King so I went back downstairs and the friendly hotel staff moved me to a King immediately. The room was indeed small but functional. When you’re in NYC you’re not spending too much time in the room so who cares if it’s tight? The room smelled very clean and it looked clean too! The bed was amazing, very comfortable. They changed the linens daily for me. The bathroom is about 4 feet from the bed… very close. The bathroom came with the basic shampoo, conditioner and lotion but no body wash (just soap). I didn’t have any problems with water temperature which was nice. The flat screen TV was a good touch, although I didn’t spend much time watching it. I have to agree with others that the shades do not fully block the light. I was facing the street and the room was bright beginning at 7am. I found that with the windows closed I couldn’t hear the usual city noises so I have no complaints about the noise. I also never heard the bar or club that others speak of… maybe because I was on the 11th floor. My room was directly outside the ice machine and I didn’t hear that either. The fire alarm did go off at 3:30am during my stay but no one left… it was shut off within 10 minutes. The lobby has free juice and coffee in the mornings, which is a good start to the day… saves some money! The location is hard to beat for the price! It is so close to the 23rd Street subway stops. I walked everywhere. Times Square is about a 10 minute walk. Empire State Building is close by. I even walked to Rockefeller Center, Battery Wharf, Little Italy, Chinatown and the WTC site from the hotel with no problems. Just bring walking shoes! The neighborhood feels very safe. Even coming back at 4am from Times Square I never felt in danger. If I could get a deal like I did this time, I would definitely stay at Four Points Chelsea again! I can’t see paying the sticker price of $395/night though. Overall, I didn’t encounter any problems, the staff was friendly and the location is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Hostel?”
Reviews.Author: Lucian75
Reviews.Content: Even if downtown New York, I was expecting to find a room a little bit bigger than one in hostels. Not cheap either (maybe for Chealsea NY). Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Priceline Price!”
Reviews.Author: apomrink
Reviews.Content: This is a great NYC hotel. The location was fun, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size for NYC and felt very clean. Free Starbucks coffee in the lobby. We were very happily surprised. We got a great rate via Priceline for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and small room!”
Reviews.Author: HappyGirl60
Reviews.Content: Front desk helpful, small rooms but clean and comfortable. Well located. It needs a refrigerator in the room. Moreover, perfectly serves the guests who are not in search of comfort and luxury, but practicality and easy locomotion (near of Penn Station and a few blocks from Times Square) with cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS A GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: mississaugamom
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location to see New York City. The staff is amazing going out of their way to be helpful. The staff on the front desk is extremely welcoming, nothing is too much of a problem for them, if they are able to help they will. The rooms are very clean and quiet. I have stayed at other hotels in New York City and they do not compare to the Four Points Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss...mostly miss”
Reviews.Author: briboynyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hit or miss. I'm a SPG platinum member and I've stayed at this hotel dozens of times and the regular staff recognize me by face. There is no such thing as an "upgraded" room at this hotel cause all the rooms are basically the same. Some have old tube TV's and the newer/upgraded rooms have a flat panel. Other than that there is no difference in rooms. Many times I've checked in with a confirmed king bed reservation and all they have are double beds. As a platinum guest I should ALWAYS get my confirmed reservations regardless of capacity. I always request high floors because the windows aren't that well insulated. If you happen to get a non-street facing room, especially on a low floor, you will be bombarded by noise coming from a bar on 24th street. This bar has an outdoor back patio and the noise carries all the way to the top floor. If you happen to get a room next to an Ice Machine...then goodbye sleep. Another MISS are the pull down shades. While they look modern and trendy they don't block out any light. Good luck trying to sleep in. Once I did have a room with curtains and pull down shades and this was a slight improvement in blocking out the light. When I was there last they were upgrading/fixing the elevators. They did an upgrade to the elevators a few years earlier which resulted in a really bad wood stain on the panels and burlap type of material on the rest of the cab. Unfortunately the stain was very poor and the fabric material is worn and doesn't hold up to the daily wear and tear. Hopefully this has been fixed. Four Points provides free high speed internet, but there is no WiFi in the rooms so you have to be connected via ethernet cord. Years and years ago there used to be wifi, but they've disconnected that service. Now you do get free internet via ethernet, but I wouldn't call it High Speed. Now I don't want to be totally negative. The staff has always been friendly to me upon check-in since I'm a regular hotel guest. The location is a HIT, with close proximity to public transportation, MSG, and cool neighborhoods. The rooms are faily clean and they've "modernized" the bed linens to a more contemporary/clean look. This is a HUGE improvement over the previous bedding. I booked another stay for early November and I will do another posting to see if things improved. It had such bad experiences during my last stays (double bed instead of king, low floor which was noisy, voicemail light that blinked constantly even though there was no voicemail, etc) that I've been staying at the W Times Square usually at rates only $50-75 more a night which is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “ok, far from great...”
Reviews.Author: omguru
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nites, rooms are ultra small, basic, but beds are superior......wont stay again, since so many other choices in NYC are available.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JupiterJeff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting my kids. For a moderately priced, well located (between Times Square and the Meatpacking District), Manhattan hotel it was very comfortable, clean, attractive with a helpful staff and a pleasingly soft trendy decor.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nashman2
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on price and location and were happy with both. We arrived at noon and were able to get our room right away, a nice surprise. We were on the third floor and faced the back alley, but no surprise based on the good rate we received. The staff was always attentive and nice - and allowed us to store our bags on our last day. The Whole Foods a few steps away was a great bonus. The subway lines a short walk. One complaint is typical of a lot current hotels. Why provide a flatscreen TV with not a single HD channel? Very poor channel options. Not that were there to watch TV, but still a dissapointment. Also, WiFi only in the lobby, another minus.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Larzfrommarz
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay w/ my wife for our anniversary. Knew going in the rooms were small based on previous reviews....ours was. However, room was extemely clean, bed was the famous Sheraton Sweet Sleeper....outstanding! Bathroom....could do better w/ the soap/shampoo, throw in some q-tips and maybe more than (2) medium sized bath towels. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Bar was hopping late night both nights we were there. Early check-in was available when we arrived @ 1:45. However, it was for room on 2nd floor. We opted to leave bags, returned @ 3:15 and got a room on the 18th floor (we had requested upper). We had room behind elevator, never heard it. No problems w/ leaving bags, they were stored in basement and staff brought up on elevator when we were ready to go to our room. Decent sized lobby, (2) computers w/ printer, free internet & Wi-Fi available. Numer ous deli-type businesses on both 6th & 7th Ave. Johny's on W25th IS A DEAL! Very small, almost only counter service, clean, nothing fancy, walk-up window & cheap for NYC....check it out I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but suggest they read our review!

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Starwood Property?”
Reviews.Author: undercovers
Reviews.Content: For the most part the Starwood Properties I've stayed at have been outstanding or above average - either in with service or physical plant. This hotel is by far the worst Starwood property I've stayed in to date. The physical plant of the hotel is so-so. The rooms are small, but you have to remember it IS Manhattan. However, that being said, the service is lacking... a lot. Very rude female front desk attendant who I had to deal with on the mornings that I came down to request some basic amenities and services. My hotel safe did not work, the desk lamp did not work properly, there were no glasses left in the room by the housekeeper - all three days and I had to request housekeeping service on one of the days because they skipped my room since I wasn't out before 9a.m. The fitness center is rudimentary and half the machines weren't working when I tried to use it on one of the days. The wifi in the room might be free, but it conked out often and the ethernet wire provided on the desk didn't help things much. This was the cheapest Starwood property listed in Manhattan when I booked through the SPG site, so now I know why. The only thing that this hotel has going for it is that you are in the heart of Chelsea. I would avoid this one if possible there are much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, comfy bed, what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: welldone99
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for our accommodation months ahead. Got a 30% reduction, so our 4 night stay was reasonably cheap. The hotel is in a great location. Wholefoods is on the corner of 7th/25th street, less than a minute walk away so easy to get decent cheap food to take back to your room if you don't feel like eating out. There is a great deli on the corner as well for breakfast if you don't want to eat at the hotel restaurant. Our room was on the 19th floor and we had great views of the Empire State building and the Chrysler building. Taxi's are always out the front of the hotel, so it is easy to get around if you do not want to take the sybway/buses. The bed was super comfortable, very clean room absolutely no complaints. It exceeded my expectations for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! RUN”
Reviews.Author: rjbollho
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever stayed at! I travel for work so I basically live in a hotel, but have never seen a manager so incompetent in my life. We had a wedding party here and it couldn't have gone any worse. We had rates guaranteed that didn't get honored and when we called to discuss, the manager hung up on me. Please don't waste your time here, there are much better hotels for cheaper......

Reviews.Title: “Good location for night life and ok”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravellerMunich
Reviews.Content: Well located on the border to Chelsea and easy access to the mass transportation. For a while the flag ship for Four Points Hotel with small but comfortable rooms. Very comfortable bed, small bathroom and sometimes a bit noisy. the last few month the conditions of the rooms changed to the negative side. Service is okay. The price is compared to similar hotels in the neighborhood sometimes too high.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: themadzins
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a king room on the SPG Preferred Guest floor. We used cash plus points for this stay so the cost was so reasonable for NYC. The parking was an additional $30 at a garage a few doors down. There is another garage nearby that charges guests only $25 but is a bit further away. Our room was huge for NYC standards. We had a king bed, a chair and a half, coffee table, desk, and flat screen. From our window we cold see the Empire State Building. That was such a great added bonus. The bath was good and the shower pressure was good. Only drawback in the bath is that storage area is extremely limited. The hotel should consider adding a few extra shelves. The staff were very nice at check in and gave us all the information and subway directions that we needed. The location is great. There is a great pub around the corner, Rogue, which had great food for lunch. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Value for Money Ever - but nice people and location”
Reviews.Author: anoush14
Reviews.Content: Nice location, friendly staff, but I lost sleep here because I can't believe how badly I'm being ripped off at $420 (after taxes) a night for a room in this place. Uneven floors, cracked stuff in the bathroom, the shower is a joke (only 2nd to the water pressure), old gross furniture. I know it's NY and we're talking small rooms, buy seriously - over $400 a night ? I'll never come back and I'm shocked that they call this a Sheraton. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ivysdaughter
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just spent four days at the Four Points Sheraton. We were very pleased with this small slightly "funky" hotel that was located in a quiet neighborhood and very close to the subway. Our room was spotless and very quiet and comfortable. We found the staff to be most accomodating and willing to give us directions and tips on dining and sightseeing. After checking out in the morning we were able to store our luggage at no charge until the airport shuttle picked us up after dinner. We had several good meals in the neighborhood and we preferred the smaller ethnic restaurants to the overpriced and boring food in the uptown areas. Don't miss Soho, Grenich Village and lower Manhattan. Buy a Metrocard and you will be getting around town like a native. We never took a taxi once. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok- Convenient to subway lines”
Reviews.Author: TamPgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just ok, but the price was right for a Manhattan hotel. The rooms are tiny as at least one other reviewer noted, but most rooms in Manhattan are. The size wasn't much different from other Manhattan hotels I've stayed at. The neighborhood is very quiet. There are a couple of delis and restaurants nearby for breakfast and late night snacks so that was good. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating and maid service was also exceptional. We had a problem with our window closing and maintenance promptly arrived to handle the problem. Two main subway lines have stops just two blocks from the hotel- one on sixth and one on seventh. From these two lines we could easily get just about anywhere in the city, which is why we stayed here. It's definitely an ok place to stay, but not party central or some place you would want to hang out. It's a good place to rest your head and shower and then spend the day out exploring the city. There is a restaurant/nightclub behind the lobby, but it was very quiet when we were there. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Above-Average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbsduck
Reviews.Content: I love staying in Chelsea - it's quieter than the Village or Midtown, but accessible to both. The Four Points is a nice quiet hotel on a side street off Seventh Avenue, close to the subways. The rooms are very clean & the beds are extremely comfortable. Smallish room, of course, but that's NYC. I liked that the complimentary coffee in the lobby & the guest rooms was starbucks, and that they gave us free bottled water each night. It's a very narrow building, so all of the rooms surround the elevator, but it didn't bother us too much. And, there's barely any lobby to speak of - especially with the computer stations in the middle of it. And, the exercise room is laughable - 3 or 4 cardio machines & no universal gym or free weights. But, the reality is - we weren't planning on spending much time in the common areas. We liked the room & got out early in the morning to sightsee. My one real complaint is that I had pre-booked a room with a king-sized bed AND pre-paid for the 4-night stay in advance. When we arrived, they didn't honor the booking. Instead, they gave us a room with 2 full-size beds. They said they'd get us into a king room by the second night, then didn't. And, they tried to say I had agreed to the full-size beds when I checked in - a complete lie. It took a phone call to American Express before they "found" an available king room. I don't like that kind of customer "service."

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about a $6.00-$8.00 cab ride from anywhere we wanted to go in the City, and walking distance from some great restaurants around the Flatiron district. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was clean and well-appointed. Everything looked new, so maybe some of the rooms have been renovated? The elevator was being refinished when we arrived (I noticed a reviewer below mentioned it looked shabby). We found a discounted rate online, and for the price in Manhattan, we were thrilled. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were amazing”
Reviews.Author: JulieGMelbAust
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty dated and needs refurbishing but the beds were absolutely wonderful. Room size was surprisingly big for new york standards, i have stayed in NY many times before and rooms are generally tiny but this was what you would expect anywhere else in the world. Location was ok, were eateries nearby but generally would head out on the subway to downtown for better restaurants etc. Good availability of free internet in the foyer, although the use of this is not monitored and many times was being used by uni students that had walked in off the street and used while hotel guests waited. Bar was run by a separate company and was not inviting nor very friendly if you didnt "fit" their target market. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ILoveagoodbreak
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews was a bit reluctant, but very pleasantly surprised. Lobby had very friendly receptionist whatever time of day. Complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning as well as limited drink facility in room. Slightly noisy air con in room was not a problem after touring and walking all day. Bathroom clean and shower good. Two ample size beds in the twin room with four pillows each (luxury to me!!) and comfort beds. Central position in mid town a few blocks to Flat Iron Building which is on the hop on hop off bus route. Subway a few blocks away. Good whole food supermarket close by also which had everything you could want. Free use of computer with internet access in lobby also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EamonWild
Reviews.Content: The hotel is shoe-horned into a very small patch of land, though the reception area is nice enough. The front desk staff were very helpful, polite, and made sure that I felt welcomed. The corridors and elevators looked fairly banged-up, and the rooms were tiny, though I suppose the idea is that when in New York you're not spending much time there. I was in walking distance of transit, good food and all the essentials. The staff definitely made my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: charles847
Reviews.Content: Great Location, close to what Chelsea has to offer and close to subway. I was greeted by a cramped and chaotic lobby scene. Staff at front desk was helpful and pleasant. The King room was decent sized and quiet. The finishes are all a bit tired and worn; wobbly faucet handles in bathroom, scratched furniture, worn chair. The bed is very comfortable. Service requests were handled quickly: call for extra coffee and towels responded to quickly. I would stay here again as the basics were all handled well. But, don't expect much in terms of atmosphere or rooms other than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with my stay”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: I book two nights at the Four Points for a business trip. I imagine the pictures on their site have been "prettied up." But what hotel doesn't do that? The rooms are small - but this is New York City. It's a relatively small hotel - there are only about 8 rooms per floor. The bedding is the currently popular soft bedding. It's comfortable for those who like soft bedding. I don't mind it, but I'm not used to soft bedding. The bathroom is very small. The shower water pressure could use some help. But at least they don't have aerated showerheads. The staff, on the other hand, were a pleasure. Very nice and accomodating. The location is good if you are spending time in Chelsea. I've never really spent time in that part of Manhattan, so I don't know if that's something people generally do. Overall, a good hotel... no complaints to speak off.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Sam1256
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. I travel a lot, both nationally and internationally. But, I have never had an experience as bad as my recent stay in this hotel. First of all, the hotel is nothing like the pictures they show on their websites. It is small, tired and poorly maintained. The lobby and the restaurant are a joke. Your local McDonald looks better, cleaner and has a better menu. On our first night, we got broken pipe in the bathroom which flooded the room. Despite our attempts to notify the staff, no-one would respond. So much so that by the time they responded, half of our room was flooded and the room bellow us was dripping with water from the ceiling. We had to re-pack and change room. The next day, we lost hot water while my wife was in the shower with shampoo on her hair. Apparently, their boiler turned off! It took over half an hour for the water to get warm enough for her to rinse off the shampoo and finish her shower. Two nights after, at 3:30 AM, a guest at our floor had overdosed and was yelling and crying loud in the hallway butt naked. Finally after several attempts by other guests to notify the staff, the police and fire department showed up and took the drunk and drugged guest to the hospital. By the time this event was over, it was 5:00 AM. Bad service, bad food and poorly maintained rooms and facilities. This hotel is not worth the money. Being a member of Starwood Hotels, I will forever stay away from the Sheraton Hotels. What a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - And Wait until you try the beds”
Reviews.Author: NoeleenDaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Points for 2 nights. It is a lovely quite area, but with not a lot of character and very quiet. However, it is important to remember that it is only 19 steeets from Time Square and the walk is an interesting one (in a good way) , or just jump a cab for about $5. We arrived early afternoon, expecting to have to wait for our room, only to be informed that we could check in immediately. This was a huge bonus. The room on the 16th floor was very large (by New York standard !). We booked a double room, with two double beds...... and are the beds something to write home about. They can cause you to miss out on NYC !! They were very comfortable and with pillows to sink into !! Trust me, the rave is totally warrented. The following morning, having used the small amount of coffee (starbucks) in the room, I dressed to go out and grab some more, only to find free coffee and tea set up in the reception. There is also 2 computers in the lobby giving free internet access which is always a bonus. We did not eat in the restaurant as it did not have a very appealing menu, atmosphere and the staff here very uninspiring. We did have a couple of drinks after shopping and after dinner, but again felt the lack of atmosphere and blaring music a real turn off, so did not spend a lot of time here. We would totally recommend the hotel for price, comfort and convenience. We would like to pay patricular compliments to the front of house staff, all of whom were very courteous, cheerful and helpful at all times, a real asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, short walk to subway stations, Madison Sq Garden”
Reviews.Author: Bellabree
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend five days in NYC without spending a fortune. I also didn't want to stay at some low budget, family-oriented cheesy hotel. Well, in NYC, there are few options in between luxurious and tolerable. Luckily for me, a colleague recommended the Chelsea Sheraton. The price was right--I booked only 3 weeks in advance and got rates of $179 for weeknights and $210 for the weekend. When viewed from the exterior, the hotel isn't much to look at, but once inside, it's nicely decorated with modern hues and comfortable furniture. It's located just few a blocks from Madison Square garden, diners, shops, etc. There's a Whole Foods right across the street (that's one thing that sold me on this hotel). You can walk up to W. 23 and 8th Ave and catch the C subway (no transfers necessary) uptown to the typical tourist haunts: Natural History Museum, the MET, Central Park, etc. There are several Duane Reade's, Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks within a very short walking distance. But why not try some of the nicely priced local diner and restaurants? Hotel rooms come equipped with a coffee machine, FREE internet service (that also sold me), and fresh bottled water. The bedding is comfortable and my room and bathroom were clean. Staff are VERY courteous and friendly. The staff remembered my name and greeted me each time upon seeing me. I travel frequently and that level of staff attention is hard to find, even at the luxury hotels. The down sides? The rooms are small, but I hear that's typical for NYC. There's no fridge or microwave in the rooms. If they added a fridge and microwave to the rooms, then I'd give this place five stars. Note: If you're coming from Washington DC and taking the Bolt Bus, the bus drops you off at 33rd near Madison Square. This hotel is within walking distance--just 7-8 short blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money for occasional visit, not anything SPG members should use.”
Reviews.Author: niksal
Reviews.Content: I think the other reviews have covered most of it. If you find a good rate it's a decent hotel that provides ok value for money. Nothing spectacular, but it's well located if you just want a clean room to sleep in. It's not really close to anything, on the other hand it's not far away from anything either. Be aware that if you leave your luggage at the hotel for the day, I had to wait 15 minutes to get it when picking it up. Don't leave it to the last minute! The helpful and friendly staff other reviewers mention, I didn't really notice. Nothing wrong with them either. As a SPG Platinum member, I didn't receive really anything extra. No room upgrade, and only 250 points as amenity, despite 500 was promised during check-in. Had water and two pieces of chocolate as the gift in the room. The most annoying thing was that after the stay the usual survey came to my mailbox. Answered honestly and gave average scores. After around 30 minutes some manager from the hotel called me and wanted to know why I had not given better scores. Some could consider it a nice touch, I felt a bit pressured by him. He said he would correct my points and send me an email about discounts for future stays but I haven't seen either of them. It's not a bad hotel, I could stay there again. But don't expect anything above the ordinary, even as a Starwood elite. Personally I would next time pay a bit more and go to a W which at the time wasn't that much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice staff and very good location”
Reviews.Author: ben_steph
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on priceline and we were very pleased and felt lucky! The hotel is well located, far away enough from the noisy areas but close enough to walk to Time Square and other major attractions. Our room and bathroom were clean but on the small side to be honest... in the meantime for a NYC hotel, it is apparently fairly standard. The hotel has a gym, useful when you are jet lagged and can't sleep anymore! The reception staff and the cleaners were all very friendly, helpful and polite! We liked the free coffees every morning and the free internet access in the lobby. Definitely a hotel to be considered when looking around for some cheaper alternatives in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Karmamom
Reviews.Content: We just spent a family weekend in NYC and chose this place for it's location and we were not disappointed. The front desk are very helpful and friendly and our room was very clean. Sometimes you stay in a hotel in NYC and the rug or the cover on the bed seem iffy but this place was very clean. No concerns with that. The rooms are a bit small but then again, there were 4 us (2 adults, 2 kids). The kids spent early morning looking out on the window to the street below. There was a Whole Foods around the corner and plenty of diners in walking distance. I would definately go back because the price was good (we paid $170), location ideal, clean rooms, friendly staff and quiet hotel. Even though there was a hopping restaurant on the first floor (loud Salsa music...wish we could have stayed) we didn't hear a thing on the 9th floor. Only negative was the street noise at night - taxis etc. But it is NYC

Reviews.Title: “Consistent”
Reviews.Author: kevinh73
Reviews.Content: This is a reliable hotel for me whenever I take my yearly trip to NYC. I've stayed here at least four, five times already. It's in a very good location for me. Very close to Whole foods so I can pick up whatever I need there. It's next to 8th avenue so easy to grab cab to go up to Midtown for shows or shopping. I'm a SPG member so I always stayed at the higher floors. The rate is always very reasonable. Which is one of the main reason I stay at this hotel. But because it's reasonable for NYC, it also means you have to put up a few things. The hotel only has two elevators so sometimes you can be waiting for awhile for the elevator to get to you. The doors while seems substantial doesn't seem to block off sounds much. If your neighbor is talking in the hallway, you can definitely hear them. Also when they close their door, you'll definitely hear a fairly loud bang. So in a way it's kinda draw of the luck. Sometimes when I stay there, it's fairly quiet. The other times, it can be a bit loud especially if your neighbor came back from clubbing 3 o'clock in the morning. The room is nicely furnished. Some of the furniture show some sign of wear. Last time I was there, the glass shelf in the bathroom actually fell off when I put my vanity bag on top of it and I didn't even have that much stuff in the bag. But that only happened to me once from all the times I stayed here in the past so I just shrugged my shoulder and moved on. I never used their concierge service so not sure how that is. I never ate at their restaurant so again, not sure how it is. I used to live in NYC so I just need a place to park and this place is clean, reasonable and convenient so to me it's perfect. Overall I would say this is a decent place to stay for the price. I stayed at the Carlyle before and this is definitely not up to that standard. But again, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very hospitable, pleasant and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: douglasajames
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Room amenities made my stay very comfortable and enjoyable. The free access to a computer and internet was very appreciated as well as having access to the internet via Wi-Fi. The night club lounge was pleasant for an evening cocktail. Having breakfast on site was helpful. Location was just right for my business transit. And the staff were all very pleasant from the front desk, to the dinning facility as well as the toom cleaning crew. They all greeted you with a pleasant, warning smilte.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new standard NYC business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cricketwing
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, clean. The staff is super helpful and they check on you to make sure you have everything you need. It's a very well-run old-fashioned hotel experience but right in the middle of NYC. Close to restaurants, 2 blocks to #1 Subway line that takes me straight down to Wall Street. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Paulb
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days on holiday and I would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are decent sized for New York, with excellent beds and really well maintained. The staff is the best: every one was super pleasant and eager to help. Elevators are quick and efficient, and the location puts you close to Chelsea and near to the subway to get anywhere you need. The only negative was the fitness centre, but it gives you an excuse to spend more time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with super friendly staff, excellent restaurant and bar”
Reviews.Author: AllycatCanada
Reviews.Content: Very home-like feeling. Big smiles everywhere and the staff in the hotel and restaurant cannot can do enough for you. Rooms are standard but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: benthere
Reviews.Content: At first sight, I wasn't blown away by the outer appearance of the hotel or the small lobby. However, I was greeted upon check-in by a woman with a warm, friendly smile who checked me in quickly and offered me a city/subway map and asked if I wanted a wake up call. Both were appreciated (I often have to request these things). On the night when I was still in my room in the early evening, I got a call from the front desk asking if I was enjoying my stay and if I needed anything. This is one of those small touches that left a favorable impression on me. My bed was very comfortable and I slept well - save for one evening when people in a neighboring room were opening and closing their door rather loudly for a couple of hours ('though that speaks more to those guests than it does about the hotel). Another nice touch was the availability of 2 PCs in the lobby for the guests to use at no charge. This is rare and also appreciated. I used then twice to get info on places that I was going to visit. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Chas491959
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 10 days at Christmas 2009. Wonderful service and very friendly. The room was nice with a big HGTV with lots of channels. Free coffee in the morning and often cookies and hot chocholate in the evening. Free WiFi in the lobby. The king sized bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly quiet and spacious hotel - one of the best deals in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AngelesAvary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights and not only is it very centrally located (not the best neighborhood, but you can get around easily) but the hotel is clean, spacious - yes, especially by NYC standards - and amazingly quiet. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is well appointed, with very comfortable beds, a friendly staff, clean, and cheap. Couldn't recommend a budget-type hotel higher.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here....”
Reviews.Author: Diane503
Reviews.Content: if you require valet parking, onsite garage or bellman. But my hubby and I knew that before we booked the reservation and this Sheraton turned out to be a gem of a hotel! We usually stay Midtown/Uptown at the larger Starwoods, but our business brought us down to the Chelsa area. We pulled right up front, I got a luggage trolly from the lobby, we unloaded and my husband parked at the recommended garage a convenient 1 and 1/2 blocks away. Parking rates were $25 a day, below NYC price standards. Check in was a breeze with Paul doing a FAB job. In fact we found all the staff to be friendly, smiling and helpful during our 2 night stay. We stayed on the 12th floor facing the back and it was the quietest room we ever had in NYC. The hotel is on 25th St which is quiet in itself so I don't think staying street side would be a problem (just don't get a room next to he ice machine, it was literally by the door of one of the rooms). Room was smaller than we were used to but more than acceptable in size. Bathroom also on the small side, did not have a tub, but a large walk in shower which we preferred. Room and bath were pristine with not a speck of dust or dirt. Sheets were crisp, towels were large and soft and both smelled like they were hung outside on a summer day. Bed was incredibly comfortable. No problem controlling room temps. Room lighting was more than ample. We are big readers while in bed and usually have to change hotel bulbs to make them brighter or move lamps closer to the bed. Not here. Two reading lights over the bed and lights bedside were perfect! We did not eat in the restaurant or go to the bar, but when we popped our heads in to look around every staff person smiled or said hi. Two elevators were super fast and we never waited more than 30 seconds for one. Convenience of close subways both Uptown and Downtown. Free (plug-in) internet in the room with 2 computers and a printer downstairs. Coffee machine in room but we preferred the free coffee station set up each morning in the lobby. Electronic safe in armoire. We had a lovely experience at this hotel and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boonstra
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a convenient location, especially to the metro. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. It was smallish, but everything in NYC is small. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back. I got a good deal on Priceline. Not sure if I would pay full price, though. They have an agreement with a parking garage so you get parking for $25 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: MickeyGW
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. Rooms were dark and small. More lighting would have been nice. The one thing that bothered me was a getogether occuring in the room next to mine one night. I noticed that one of the people was an employee of the hotel. The next night between the hours of 12am and 2am, this employee with housekeeping were attempting, I believe, to clean up. They would go in and out of the room every few minutes between these hours, letting the door slam each time, waking me up. (They left the safety look open to blook the door from locking.) I saw they were bringing in new sheets, a vacuum, etc. I would have thought that an employee would have taken more care to not disturb other guests, especially at that hour. It made for a night that wasn't very restfull and an unproductive seminar the next day. Just dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hutch08
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Chelsea is well-located in midtown, near bus and subway lines. We got to the theatre district, and the financial district, in good time. Rooms are large by NYC standards, really comfy beds, nice showers. Service at the front desk,and from the cleaning staff was very good. We got a great price through that name your own price website. I would stay here again. Drawbacks? No great food or bar place in the hotel, but there are places nearby on 7th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ebolamonkey
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to spend to much but don't want to stay in a dump - this is a very good option in Manhattan - especially if you prefer SPG hotels... then this is definetely your best option. FREE BOTTLED WATER!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job - cant quite describe it in one sentence though”
Reviews.Author: drretta
Reviews.Content: First trip to New York so cant compare to any other hotel. When we first arrived it was one in the morning by taxi and Im glad - we were a little put off - it was such a dark area and seemed a bit daunting for two young girls. We arrived in the lobby to loud music - it actually sounded like a club - there may actually have been one in the downstairs area (luckily we couldnt hear a thing from our room). Staff were pleasant but didnt quite trust them. They told me i was prepaid (which i was) but they needed my credit card for security. Thinking this was reasonable and they'd only take the money at the end - i got a text from my bank within 10 mins saying my account had been deposited overseas. They actually take $100US as security and refund it after your stay (fine - but would like the warning - i did get the money back it doesnt register as a transaction). Bit more on staff. They were young, a bit .... alouf... didnt really seem to care. Seemed to have some attitude but would eventually help you out. Just felt like a hassle when you asked for assistance. Actually we came home one night - jumped on the free internet in the lobby (ver handy) but had to put up with a guy asleep and snoring wide-mouthed in the seat at the computer next to me. The staff member on reception was laughing - but later informed me it was the fire warden and he was on shift!!! So back to it.... from word go we had a bad impression BUT got to the room and although thought it a bit small (and the two double beds were more like 2 king singles - wide but not long) they were the MOST COMFORTABLE BED ive ever slept in. We walked a lot each day and looked forward to going back to sleep. We dont use air con - we hate it. Cracked the window and didnt find it noisy at all. Were on 10th floor. TV worked fine. TV reception was fine in our room. Room was tidy. And the website says free mineral water. It's one 500ml bottle free each day . Basically if my parents rocked up here they would have walked out - fearing it was a club but i think if you let yourself get past reception and upto your room you'll have a great sleep and feel clean and comfy in the bathroom. No room to move about but your in New York - get outside! Was close enough to a number of metro stations and during the day we realised we had quite a good area and felt plenty safe enough. I would stay here again for the beds! I would recommend to people but would explain all of the above first.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Thiol
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel in the Chelsea/Penn station area and this is exactly what I was looking for. It is a tiny hotel, there is basically no lobby except a tiny check-in counter and a couple of computers for the guests to use, and only has 8 rooms per floor. I stayed at the "starwood preferred guest floor" - floor 18. The staff told me that it is a newly renovated floor and I was very happy with my room. The room is spacious in NYC standard. The bathroom is small but clean, and beds comfortable. With the window closed, it is very quiet too. Oh, and you get free "wired" internet here, which is also nice. It is right around the corner from FIT and right next to the #1 train 28th street stop, 10 min walking to Penn station/Macy's. There are a couple of restaurants/cafes in the area, and also a whole food market across the street on 7th Ave. It is not the best neighborhood in the city but it is convenient and safe. I would stay there again. I think it is well worth the money I paid (on priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Turn back now-”
Reviews.Author: crosscountry14
Reviews.Content: From the get go this hotel is a loser. We were assigned a handicap room which I hope a handicap person never gets. The room was dark and dirty, non functioning single cup coffee maker leaked all over the wall and counter, sweaky bathroom faucet was missing handle pieces, window shades didn't block out light from the building across the street at night, and worst of all the hall way smelled of urine so badly that I needed (no kidding) to sleep with an unused open coffee filter envelope under my pillow as a potpourri. The restaurant service was slow and food and coffee was cold. You've been warned! We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertGvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea during an extended week-end (3 nights) on a leisure trip. Location is great. We arrived by train and we walked to the hotel. Rooms are perfect for short stays (a bit small, but it's NYC!) especially for leisure travelers. Internet is free, and you can print for free in the lobby. Do not rely on the restaurant, especially if you're tired: very loud music that you can ear everywhere in the lobby. Actually, when you walk in the lobby (with the loud music), you would not think you're at a Sheraton ! Finally, they seem to have serious weaknesses with regards to their internal controls. When we checked it, they processed our credit card for guarantee, confirmed the rate, the number of nights and specified we would be charged at check-out (nothing different from most hotels). When we check out, we were told that the room was prepaid (which wasn't !) and that we don't have to pay anything (about 700$ !). We insisted that the room wasn't prepaid and that she was probably checking out the wrong guests. She confirmed the room number and my name and confirmed again that it was prepaid. Since we gave a credit card guarantee I just thought that they will figure it out later and that they will charge my room later. It has been more then a year now and I have still not been charged, no phone call (they have all my personal contact information), nothing ! Who can complain to get 3 free nights in New York ?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Chelsea location!”
Reviews.Author: jaspa929
Reviews.Content: only gripe is with parking. Hotel has negotiated rate with garage on 26 th and sixth. Just not the most convenient. But rooms are clean and the bed is fantastic. Nice plazma and free internet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: taranaP
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Four Points in Manhattan this week. I got a pretty good deal on Priceline - between USD150 and 180 per night. I was traveling alone and felt safe here. The rooms are very functional, a bit snug, but have comfortable beds and a clean and modern decor. It was hot and humid in NYC and may be that's why there was a weird muggy odor in the room and in the bathroom. The free bottle of water everyday was a treat in the summer :). I kept the air conditioner on through the night due to the heat and it was a bit loud at times. The bathroom was clean and adequate. The strange thing I observed was that the bedside lamps are way up high and you couldn't reach them to turn the lights on or off without literally sitting all the way up in bed or getting out of bed. I did not eat at the hotel, but the latin food based cuisine at the restaurants and the drinks looked good. They have patio seating during the summer. There are two computers connected to the internet in the lobby and internet in the room is not free. For a ride to the airport, the staff will gladly book you a limo at about the same rate as the NYC yellow cab. I paid USD45 for a very comfortable ride to La Guardia airport which is also the going yellow cab rate. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers for leisure or business because of its convenient location. It is on a fairly quiet side street with easy access to the Avenue of the Americas, Broadway, and 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fun weekend in the city with a friend. I was able to get an excellent rate which was why we booked at the hotel.
